column9: Oh, it ’ s a pity. What was the matter?
column10: Simple. We had personality clashes and there were too many cultural differences.
column11: Like what?
column12: He hoped to live in the Korean way and asked me to give up working and stay at home to take care of the family.
column13: Oh, I see. In their culture women should put family first.
column14: Yes, he said it would be better for me and for the whole family. But I simply can not quit working.
column15: So that's why it ’ s hard to have a happy marriage with a foreigner.
column16: Not really. There are many successful mixed marriage around us.

column1: I have to move.
column2: You have not fulfilled your lease agreement yet.
column3: I can ’ t stay here anymore.
column4: There ’ s a problem with that.
column5: What is the problem?
column6: I won ’ t be able to give you back your deposit.
column7: Why not?
column8: This was stated in our agreement.
column9: But I need it back.
column10: I can ’ t do that.
column11: It will be impossible for me to stay here.
column12: That ’ s not my fault.

column1: Would you honor us with a visit?
column2: I'd love to. Thanks.
column3: When will you be convenient?
column4: Any time will suit me.
column5: Are you doing anything tomorrow?
column6: I'm free tomorrow.
column7: I'll pick you up at about nine o'clock, will it do?
column8: All right, see you then.

column1: This blouse is a special offer today. You can have it at 10 % off the regular price.
column2: It's nice, but still too expensive. Can you give me a 20 % discount?
column3: No. 10 % is my last word.
column4: Come on. Let's split the difference, 15 %.

column1: Hey John, did you register for classes yet?
column2: I register this Friday.
column3: What classes do you plan on taking?
column4: I really want to take the communication class, but I don't know if it will be available.
column5: Is that class really that popular?
column6: Yeah. I tried to get in last semester, but it was full by the time I registered.
column7: What other classes are you going to take?
column8: I still need to take English 201, but I really don't like writing.
column9: I took that class already. There is a lot of writing, but it's not that bad.
column10: Oh really? Who was the instructor? There are like 4 different instructors to choose from.
column11: I had Professor Mahoney.
column12: Is he an easy grader?
column13: I'm not sure if he is or not, but I thought he was definitely fair.
column14: Do you mind if I ask you what you got?
column15: Not at all. I got a 3.8.
column16: Well, what did you get in English 101 last year?
column17: I got a 4.0 in that class.
column18: Well, I can't compare to you. I got a 3.1 in English 101. That means if you got a lower grade in English 201, it must be harder.
column19: It's not what it appears. I actually tried harder in the 101 class. If I put as much effort into the 201 class, I would have received the same grade.

column1: let's go swimming.
column2: But, we just finished eating lunch.
column3: I know, but I'm really hot.
column4: I'd strongly recommend that you wait for a while before going swimming.

column1: Well, Randy, I'd say you've got a bad case of the flu. The main thing to do is get plenty of rest and drink lots of liquids. I'll prescribe something for that throat.
column2: Thanks, doctor. Is there anything I can take for this headache?
column3: Some aspirin or Panadol should help. You can pick some up at the pharmacy when you go to fill your prescription.
column4: Okay.
column5: Goodbye, Randy. Take care.

column1: You know that? Dan got a divorce.
column2: Really? I thought he loved his wife very much.
column3: Yeah. But his relation with Sallycome to a sticky end and was found by his wife.
column4: He deserved it.

column1: You have a lovely house, Jack.
column2: Thank you. But a number of things have been going wrong lately.
column3: That's too bad. What problems are you having.
column4: Oh, the whole house needs re-painting for starters. The carpet in the living room is worn out, and I'd like to put in new wall-to-wall carpeting. Last week, I had to call the plumber to fix the toilet. Anyway, all par for the course when you own a house, I guess. I think I am going to hire an interior decorator to look the place over.
column5: I ’ Ve studied home decoration as a hobby. Could I make some suggestions?
column6: Go right ahead.
column7: Well, I think a crystal chandelier would look great in your living room, and maybe some new drapes for the windows. Also, a grandfather clock would look great in the den. Perhaps you could buy some potted plants for the dining room
column8: Well, you really do have a talent for this, Alice. Thanks for the suggestions.
column9: You are welcome, Jack. Glad to be of help.

column1: I dislike Susan. She is always above herself.
column2: Don ’ t you know that she was the only one who had received the invitation in the office?
column3: What of it?
column4: Sure.

column1: What did you do today?
column2: Played poker with my work friends.
column3: Did you win?
column4: Of course.

column1: Bob returned from Japan last week. You know that?
column2: Yeah. I met him yesterday.He' s no longer the same young man as he was eight years ago.
column3: I think so, too.

column1: What's your favorite kind of music? Do you like pop music?
column2: I like almost all kinds of music. But I like country music best.
column3: There was a concert country music last week.
column4: I wish I had been there!
column5: I like it, too. But sometimes I enjoy jazz and classical music.
column6: You have good taste in music.

column1: Excuse me. Could you help me?
column2: Certainly. What can I do for you?
column3: I'm looking for a leather belt for my husband.
column4: Do you know what size he wears?
column5: Size 36... I think.
column6: And what color would you like?
column7: Dark brown, if you have it.
column8: Okay. Let's see... a size 36 dark brown leather belt. Oh, yes. Her e we are. Do you think your husband will like this one?
column9: Yes. I'm sure he will. I'll take it.
column10: Will this be cash or charge?
column11: Do you take Master Card?
column12: No, I'm afraid not. We only accept our own store credit card.
column13: Oh. In that case, I'll pay cash.

column1: so, which sport do you prefer---basketball or baseball?
column2: to be honest, I don't really care for either one.
column3: I thought everyone liked basketball. Why don't you like it?
column4: I used to play basketball when I was little, and I never scored a goal. Every time I watch a basketball game, I think about how horrible I was at it.
column5: that makes sense.
column6: how about you? What's your favorite sport of all time?
column7: my absolute favorite is ice hockey.
column8: have you ever seen a live game?
column9: sure, many times. It's an exciting game for spectators to watch.
column10: I've never really understood the game.
column11: it's not that difficult. If you want to watch a game with me, I can explain the rules and the tactics while we're watching.
column12: thanks, that'd be nice. When's the next ice hockey game on?
column13: not for a while, but we could watch an old one on the internet so I can explain the game to you.
column14: that's a good idea.
column15: let's watch the Canadian team. They have a good manager and a great coach.

column1: Going to the gym tonight, Mary?
column2: Yes, Sally. I want to do some sit-ups and perhaps get in a game of singsong.
column3: That sounds like fun. Would you mind some company?
column4: I'd love it. Working out is more fun with a friend.
column5: I'll get my things and meet you there.
column6: Good. If you happen to see Jim and Bob on the way see if they would like a game of singsong.

column1: What kind of music do you enjoy listening to?
column2: I enjoy listening to all kinds of music.
column3: What kind?
column4: I like to listen to Rock and R & B.
column5: Why do you like that type of music?
column6: I like the kinds of instruments that they use.
column7: I think that's an excellent reason to like something.
column8: Thanks, I feel the same way.

column1: Hello.
column2: Hi, my sweetheart. It ’ s Dad.
column3: Hi, Dad. Where are you?
column4: I ’ m at work right now. You can reach me at 905 675 9870. Please call this number if you need me.
column5: Thank you, Dad.
column6: I love you.
column7: I love you, too, Dad.

column1: On balance, dress designing appeals to me most.
column2: Yes, it's to my liking, too.
column3: Say, how would you like to be a dress designer?
column4: It's my dream.

column1: Your teacher has left you not very much homework this weekend.
column2: Yes.
column3: My advice would be to finish it at once.

column1: Bob!
column2: Anne! I haven't seen you for ages. How've you been?
column3: Fine, just fine. And you?
column4: Not bad. It really is great to see you again. W here have you been?
column5: Guangzhou. I've got a cousin there.

column1: Good morning. Can I help you?
column2: Yes. Do you have any seats available on a flight for Beijing leaving at 15
column3: Sure we do. First-class or economy?
column4: One economy, please.

column1: Well, how does it look?
column2: It's a perfect fit.
column3: Let me pay for it now.
column4: Cash, credit card, or debit card?
column5: I think I'll use my credit card.
column6: Your signature here, please, and we're finished.
column7: Here's my John Hancock.
column8: Bye-bye. Visit us again soon!

column1: Nice to see you, Patrick.
column2: Bob! I hear your team won the match.
column3: Yeah. All of us tried our best.
column4: Congratulations!
column5: Thanks.

column1: Hi, chary, are you busy this evening?
column2: sorry, I'm afraid that I've got plans tonight.
column3: what are you doing?
column4: I'm going to my parents' house for my father's birthday.
column5: how old is he today?
column6: it's his 50th birthday.
column7: well, wish him a happy birthday for me.
column8: sure thing. What are your plans for the evening?
column9: I was just thinking of going to a movie tonight.
column10: well, if you can wait until tomorrow night, I'll go with you then.
column11: sorry, I've got people coming over tomorrow night.
column12: sounds like this weekend just isn't going to work out for us.
column13: sounds that way. Maybe some other time then?
column14: sure.Hey, I'm sorry, but I've got to get going.
column15: yeah, me, too. It's about time I made a move.
column16: say hello to your friends for me.
column17: likewise. See you later.
column18: Bye!

column1: Could you please help me to check out the book?
column2: Sure, what's the author's name, please.
column3: I can't remember that clearly. It probably be Charles...
column4: Charles Dickens?
column5: No, no, no. I'm not interested in literature.
column6: OK, do you know the title of the book?
column7: Oh, sorry. I'm always absent-minded. I remember that I've put a note in my pocket.
column8: So, show me the note please.
column9: I can't find it now.
column10: Oh, such bad luck, sir. Can you please name the category of the book?
column11: Let me see. It's not fiction. It's biography.
column12: OK, I'll search it for you. A moment, please.
column13: Thanks.

column1: Kim, have you made contact with Mr. Lee?
column2: Not yet, Mr. Wang. But I'm working on it.
column3: What seems to be the problem?
column4: I just keep getting a busy signal.
column5: Maybe his phone is out of order. Anyway, keep working on it. I really need an answer about the contract I sent him.
column6: All right, I'll let you know when I get through.

column1: Hello, my name is Xu Hua. I'm from Beijing.
column2: Hello, Xu Hua. I'm Paula. I'm American.
column3: Welcome to China, Paula.
column4: Thank you.

column1: Do I have to deposit my handbag at the checkroom?
column2: No, you do not have to. The handbag can be taken with you. There is the cart at the entrance.
column3: Thank you. I'd tike to buy some milk powder for my baby. Is there anything that you can recommend for me?
column4: Well, how old is your baby?
column5: No more than three.
column6: The milk powder on the second level of the shelf is for the kids from 2 ages to 4 ages. I advice that you should buy the Wyeth brand, the source of milk is imported from New Zealand.
column7: How about its quality?
column8: You can be assured of it. There are various nutritions which are beneficial for the growth of babies' bone and cerebrum.
column9: OK, what is this?
column10: It is feeding-bottle as the free gift.
column11: It is thoughtful. I will take it.

column1: You know John?
column2: Which John? Mr.Turnbow ’ s son?
column3: Yes. I ’ Ve read news about him in today ’ s paper.
column4: And he ’ s bright and intelligent. I ’ m sure he can pass the university entrance exam.
column5: I wish he could too.
column6: How ’ s your boy, Jack?
column7: He ’ s a bit tired, you know. It often takes him a couple of hours to brush up.
column8: Poor boys! They work harder at school nowadays, don ’ t they?
column9: Good luck to them.

column1: Come back. You haven't paid yet.
column2: May, just let him go.
column3: But he took some newspaper away without paying.
column4: I know.
column5: Why? You make me confused.
column6: He lives nearby and he would just glance at the newspaper headlines, read the political sections and return them later.
column7: Why does he have such a privilege?
column8: He used to be a hero during the war time and everyone respect him.
column9: I see. Does he live by himself?
column10: Yes, he has no children and his wife passed away when he was in the battle.
column11: He must be lonely?
column12: I bet. But he is always busy telling the children stories.
column13: How respectable!

column1: Hello, do you know anywhere that sells cheap cashmere sweaters?
column2: Outlets have cheap cashmere sweaters.
column3: What a splendid idea!
column4: Outlets usually give you great deals.
column5: Thanks for helping me.
column6: You're welcome.

column1: What a wonderful sight!
column2: Yes. I've dreamed a thousand times that I could lie down here to relax.
column3: We are tired of jobs and competition. We need a quiet place.
column4: I'd like to stay here for all my life if possible.
column5: So would I. Look, it might be going to rain.
column6: I don't think it will spoil our trip.
column7: It will give us better feeling and atmosphere if it rains.
column8: Let's kick off our shoes to walk on the green flag stoned roads.
column9: That's a good idea!

column1: Sir, what's wrong with you?
column2: I have a spasm of nausea and dizziness.
column3: Have you ever suffered from airsickness before? You're probably airsick.
column4: No, this is the first time on a plane. Maybe you are right.. Please get me some pills.
column5: OK. I will get some for you. There's an airsickness bag behind the seat in front of you.Please wait me for a moment. ( Go away for a few minutes, and now she comes back. ) Here are two pills. And the water is in the glass too.Please take the pills with water.
column6: Thank you very much. ( Take the pills. )
column7: Are you feeling better now?
column8: Much better now. Thanks again.
column9: My pleasure.

column1: My parents are always saying I am not good enough.
column2: Really. What do they mean?
column3: They say my hair is too long, my room is too dirty and I am not good enough at school.
column4: What do you think then?
column5: I don ’ t think they are right. I have tried my best and that's enough. It is unfair that they are always saying these thing. Sometimes I even feel deeply hurt.

column1: Did anyone call?
column2: Just Mr. White.
column3: What did he want?
column4: He wouldn't say over the phone.

column1: excuse me, is this the way to the Greta Wall?
column2: oh, it is really far from here. You ’ re going in the wrong direction actually.
column3: I must have taken a wrong turn.
column4: it doesn ’ t matter. Go back the way you came. After about five kilometers, you ’ ll see a hotel on the side of the road. It ’ s a big one. You can ’ t miss it.
column5: and then?
column6: take the next right. Drive about one click further, and you ’ ll see the entrance of the highway to the Great Wall.
column7: thanks a lot.
column8: you ’ re welcome.
column9: by the way, how long does it take?
column10: without traffic, it takes about an hour.
column11: I heard the Great Wall closes early in the afternoon. Do you think I can make it before closing?
column12: yes, I think so. It doesn ’ t close until 5 o ’ clock. You still have plenty of time.
column13: great! Thank you!
column14: my pleasure, and have a good time!

column1: Can you tell me the best way to see the city?
column2: Sure, I advise the sightseeing buses.
column3: Travel by the buses? That sounds interesting.
column4: Yes of course.You can see the whole city on the bus. It's cheap as well as efficient.
column5: Oh, there comes the bus.

column1: For the 100th anniversary of the opening of the library we are going to have a party.
column2: That's a wonderful way to celebrate this grand old library!
column3: I hoped you would be willing to brainstorm with me for party ideas.
column4: That is right up my alley. You say party and I'm there.
column5: Perfect. It will be open to the public and we anticipate roughly about five to seven hundred people.
column6: Will it be an all day event?
column7: Yes. And we checked with the city and we have permission to use the park adjacent to the library.
column8: That was quick thinking.

column1: Here is your bill. It's $ 60.
column2: What's this amount for?
column3: It's for the drinks.
column4: I see. Can I pay by credit card?
column5: Sure.

column1: Don't tell me that's your lunch?
column2: No, this is just my appetizer... this is my lunch!
column3: A candy bar for an appetizer and a piece of pie for lunch! That's all junk!
column4: This is good food, it has milk, fruit, grains, nuts...
column5: Sugar, sugar, preservatives, fats, more sugar, more fat, more preservatives!
column6: At least I enjoy my lunch! What's in your bag?
column7: My wife sent me with rice, vegetables, and some curry chicken.
column8: There's the difference, your wife made it! I have to make my own lunch!

column1: I wonder if it is possible that we organize a dinner party for all the colleagues in our departments. They are working very hard these days. Maybe it is time for everybody to relax a little.
column2: That is a good idea, I love it. What time do you think is convenient?
column3: Well, what about this Thursday evening after we finish the weekly meeting?
column4: Ok, I will inform everybody when they come back from lunch. It has been a long time since we had the department dinner last time. I am sure they don ’ t want to miss it.
column5: I hope so. Let me know how many will come. Then I will book the restaurant.

column1: Hello, three-five.
column2: Is that Anne?
column3: I'm sorry, I'm very tired. I'm going to bed early. I didn't have good time, and I don't really want to see you again.
column4: What are you talking about? We had a great time. We laughed and talked all night last time.
column5: It was hardly all night. And I recall it was you doing all the laughing at your own jokes.
column6: That's not fair. We had fun. Give me a second chance. Can we meet tomorrow night for drinks at the pub?
column7: No, I' m sorry. I'm going to meet some friends tomorrow evening. And I' m too tired now. I have to go to sleep. Goodbye.
column8: But Anne...

column1: Linda, John and I are going to get married next week.
column2: That's wonderful. Congratulations.
column3: Thank you, Linda. We would love you to come to our wedding.
column4: I'd love to. What date is it?
column5: It's May 1st.
column6: What day is that?
column7: It's Saturday. Could you make the time?
column8: Yes, sure. What time will the wedding begin?
column9: At nine sharp.
column10: Very good! I'm looking forward to it. Please give my best regards to John. And I wish you best luck!
column11: Thanks.

column1: I want to settle my account.
column2: Wait for a moment. Mr. Bush.this is your bill, please sign your name here
column3: Well, I think something must be wrong with my bill. I didn't have any laundry.
column4: I am sorry, we will connect with the room service.Please Warta moment.

column1: Doris, Helen Mall is having a big sale this weekend. Do you wanna go?
column2: Don't feel like it. I'm broke.
column3: Well, we can still do some window shopping, can we?
column4: Just look around? Nah, that ’ s boring.
column5: I'll go by myself then.

column1: What was the last movie you saw?
column2: A Korean film called Friends, starring Sang Dong-gun.
column3: Really? I've seen that movie, too.
column4: How did you like the movie?
column5: I thought it was pretty good.
column6: Really? I can't say I agree.
column7: You're kidding. The story and acting were outstanding.
column8: I guess I expected too much from the movie, so I was a bit disappointed.
column9: I guess it could happen.

column1: Hey, you, pick up that piece of garbage!
column2: Huh? Me?
column3: Yeah, you. I just saw you throw a piece of garbage on the ground. Can't you read the No Littering sign? It's a $ 500 penalty for littering, so go pick it up and put it in the garbage can over there.
column4: Why should I do that? It's only a piece of garbage. Why should you care?
column5: Because this is a public place, and I want to spend my time here without having to look at your garbage.
column6: Listen, I really don't know why you're making this into such a big issue. It's only a small piece of garbage in a large space. It's not like there's garbage everywhere. Besides, someone will come along to clean it up at some time or another.
column7: It's not the cleaner's responsibility to pick up after lazy people. It's part of your responsibility to make sure that the place is neat for other people. If everyone thought like you, there'd be garbage everywhere! The cleaners can't be everywhere!
column8: Ok, whatever. See, I'm putting it in the garbage can.
column9: Hold on, that's an item. You should put that in the recycle bin next to the trashcan.

column1: May I recommend you Tsingtao beer?
column2: Tsingtao beer?
column3: Yes, sir. It's one of the best beers in China.
column4: Really?
column5: Yes. The beer is brewed by using carefully selected malts, rice, hops and natural water from the Lao Mountain.
column6: How about its taste?
column7: Fine, sir.
column8: That sounds great. Two Tsingtao beers, please.
column9: Tin or bottle?
column10: Tin, please.
column11: Would you like it on the rocks, sir?
column12: No, thank you.
column13: You're welcome.

column1: I'm so glad we decided to go on a cruise for our vacation.
column2: Are you even glad that we get to buy new clothes too?
column3: Ah, that's all part of the fun. What do you think of these shorts?
column4: They look really good on you. They look comfortable too.
column5: They are. I think I'm going to get a hat too.
column6: Okay. I chose this swimming suit. Do you like it?
column7: Wow. You look great.
column8: Great and white! Which reminds me, let's pick up some heavy duty sunscreen!

column1: Good evening.
column2: Good evening. My wife and I would like a room, please. Is there any room available? We don't have a reservation.
column3: Let me see. Yes, we have one room left. You're lucky. It's the last one.
column4: Good. We're tired after driving all day, and we're looking forward to relaxing in a comfortable room.
column5: This room has two double beds. It's number 56 at the rear of the motel. It's quite a comfortable room.
column6: How much is it for one night? We only need it for tonight. We're going to continue our trip in the morning.
column7: It's forty-five dollars a night for two. Is anyone else traveling with you?
column8: No, it's just the two of us.
column9: Would you like to pay for the room in cash or with a credit card?
column10: Credit card. We don't like to carry much cash with us on our trips.
column11: Please fill out this registration card. Here is your key. You can park your car in front of our room.Check - out time is noon.
column12: Thank you very much.
column13: Thank you, sir. Enjoy your stay with us.

column1: When is your birthday?
column2: August 1st.
column3: Do you usually have a birthday party?
column4: Yes, we do.My parents prepare dinner for me.
column5: What would you do at the party?
column6: We sing " Happy Birthday " at the party and have birthday cakes.
column7: Do you know when people began to sing the song " Happy Birthday "?
column8: Well, I don't know.
column9: Let me tell you the story.In 1892, Patty Smith Hill and Mildred Hill wrote a song called' Good Morning to you'. But later someone added the words' Happy Birthday' to their tune.
column10: So the' Happy Birthday' song has been popular since then?
column11: Yes, actually, the song has been sung since its publication in 1932.People all over the world have sung it in many different languages.

column1: How was the party last night? Did you enjoy it?
column2: Oh, don ’ t talk to me about last night! It was the most awful evening I ’ Ve ever had.
column3: Why? What happened?
column4: Well. Mary had promised to be my date, but she stood me up. I waited for her for a full hour in the cold wind.
column5: What about the party?
column6: It was boring. The music was too slow and the food was lousy and, above all, I was really sick of the same old crowd all the time.
column7: So how long did you stay?
column8: I left after the opening dance. I couldn ’ t wait to get out of there.

column1: That ’ s really a let-down.
column2: Yeah. He really does let me down.
column3: But that should not be the reason for you to lose heart.
column4: I ’ m at the end of tether. I run out of ideas.

column1: I was just watching a documentary on tv about people use dogs for various purpose. It was very interesting.
column2: I love dogs. They have been used as guards for centuries. Nowadays, they are often used to find illegal drugs and bombs by the police and customs officers.
column3: The documentary also pointed out that they are used by shepherds to round up sheep and by rescue workers to find people trapped under rubble or snow.
column4: Horses are useful to people too. We use them for sports and recreation.
column5: Don ’ t forget that horses are still used in many countries to pull ploughs and carts.
column6: Can you ride a horse?
column7: Yes, I can. I don ’ t ride regularly though. How about you?
column8: I can ride too. Perhaps we could go horse riding together at the weekend?
column9: What a good idea!

column1: I'll be on business for a couple of days, could you take care of your sister?
column2: OK, Mum, when will you be back?
column3: I'll be back in ten days.

column1: Can we talk?
column2: Sure, honey, we ’ re talking now, aren ’ t we?
column3: You know what I mean.
column4: Yeah. I know.
column5: I want to know where this relationship is going. I ’ m in love with you and I need to know...
column6: You know, I think you ’ re awesome.
column7: I ’ m awesome. Well, I guess that ’ s my answer, isn ’ t it.
column8: Honey...
column9: Look, if you don ’ t love me, it ’ s not a thing, alright, we ’ Ve had our laughs, but I don ’ t appreciate... maybe it ’ s just time we...
column10: Baby, I love you so much.
column11: You do?
column12: I love you. And I think you ’ re awesome.
column13: Oh, I love you too!
column14: Come on. Put the gun down.
column15: Oh baby, I ’ m so sorry.

column1: Thanks for inviting me to your friend ’ s wedding. I was surprised to hear the bride and groom talking to each other that way during the marriage ceremony. Is that common?
column2: Well, some people use a standard set of words, but many couples today write their own wedding vows.
column3: Your tradition of throwing rice as they got into their car was interesting, but it didn't look like real rice to me.
column4: It wasn't. It was birdseed. We don't throw rice anymore because someone discovered that birds come along and eat the rice and have trouble digesting it.
column5: Oh, I didn't think of that. Well, this reception reminds me of weddingparties back in China. Plenty of food and drink, music and dancing, and interesting traditions.
column6: Wait until you see what happens next! The bride is getting ready to throw her bouquet. Let's go over and watch.
column7: She ’ s got quite a crowd around her. Oh, look! That little girl caught it!
column8: She ’ s my friend ’ s ten-year-old niece. I guess there won ’ t be another wedding in this family for a long time.

column1: Steven, shall we go shopping tomorrow?
column2: Hum... Why not go shopping the day after tomorrow? Tomorrow is Saturday. I hate all the hustle and bustle of Saturday shopping.
column3: But Sunday is the same with Saturday. If you don ’ t mind, that's OK.
column4: Hum.Maybe it will be better. The most important thing is that I can have a day to relax after a week's work.
column5: I see. We will go the day after tomorrow.
column6: By the way, what kind of stores do we need to go?
column7: I want to buy some clothes in clothing store. When we are going back, go to the butcher's shop and buy some chicken.
column8: Let ’ s also go to the jewelry store to buy a crystal necklace. I want to buy one for you as your birthday present.
column9: Thank you, darling.

column1: Thank you for organizing this great baby shower for me! I ’ Ve always been to baby showers but never actually had one held for me! Let ’ s get started!
column2: Ok, let ’ s start opening some presents!
column3: Oh look! What a great little bib for the baby! This will definitely come in handy! Oh wow, you also got me a stroller! That ’ s so great! Thank you!
column4: This next one is from Betty.
column5: A highchair and car seat! Wow Betty, thank you so much! I really appreciate it!
column6: One more from Carla.
column7: A playpen and crib! Thanks Carla! This is just what I needed!
column8: OK, that ’ s all of them. No more gifts. Now who wants to guess when the baby is due?
column9: Umm. I think my water just broke! Get me to a hospital!

column1: I don ’ t understand why you always look so happy, so energetic. It seems like you ’ Ve got good news everyday.
column2: Really? Do I look happy all the time?
column3: All I know is you look quite differently from other teachers.
column4: Oh, do you know why? Actually, it ’ s easy. Because I always exercise. My exercise, I think, is very hard. I often feel very good after conquering these difficulties. I feel alive!
column5: Oh, I know. I saw you doing pull-ups one time on the campus 5 and some students trying to imitate you.
column6: Yeah, they are doing it for fun. Seldom would people like my exercise. It ’ s difficult and boring.
column7: It ’ s true. Many students do the exercise when they have to. We have P. E. once a week.
column8: But I think Chinese students need to exercise more. Besides exercise will help them learn new things better. Don ’ t students want to have a good memory?
column9: Of course. I didn ’ t know that. I only know exercise makes bodies stronger. I should take some exercise then. Do you have any suggestions?
column10: Well, do what you like to do. It can be anything. Jogging, doing aerobics, going bicycling, and playing ping-pong. Absolutely anything. Doing three or more workouts a week is good for you. But remember to do some stretches first.
column11: Oh, I know. Thank you.

column1: Good morning, sir. May I help you?
column2: Good morning. I'd like to pay my bill.
column3: OK. In cash or by credit?
column4: In cash. How much is the total charge?
column5: Five hundred and thirty yuan altogether including charges for service.
column6: Here you are. Thanks for your wonderful service.
column7: Not at all. Welcome again.

column1: Excuse me, can you tell me where I can go fishing?
column2: I like fishing too. I usually fish near the lake.
column3: I want to go fishing today, but I have left my rod and fishing line at home.
column4: What a shame.

column1: Hello, Mary. Why are you standing here in the cold wind?
column2: I ’ m waiting for a bus and going for a walk in the park.
column3: Going for a walk in such a cold weather?
column4: I always like to go for a walk before a supper.
column5: I see.

column1: Hi, I'd like to return this radio.
column2: All right. Do you have the receipt?
column3: Here it is.
column4: May I ask why you're returning the radio?
column5: It does not work very well.
column6: Would you like to exchange it?
column7: No. I'd just like a refund.
column8: Certainly. This will take only a few seconds.

column1: Can I help you, sir?
column2: I want to have a haircut.
column3: Please take a seat. Do you need a shampoo?
column4: How much is a regular haircut without shampoo?
column6: And how much for haircut with shampoo?
column7: The total charge is $ 15.
column8: Since it is, I need a haircut with shampoo.
column9: Well, what shampoo do you prefer?
column10: SEEK, please.
column11: ( 5 minutes later ) What sort of hairstyles do you like?
column12: What hairstyle do you feel will look best on me?
column13: I think a crew cut is the most suitable for you.
column14: I have the same idea as you.

column1: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
column2: Why don't we spend this vacation earning our tuition?
column3: Oh, yeah, let's try to find some jobs.
column4: OK.

column1: So it looks like we start selling in the U. S. next year.
column2: Did Mr. Lin put you in charge of marketing?
column3: He's still not sure whether he wants to put me in charge, or whether he wants to hire an American.But even if he hires an American, I'll probably be transferred to our American office.
column4: Where will it be?
column5: We aren't sure yet. Maybe L. A. I think L. A. would be the best idea.
column6: Is it because of trade negotiations that we can start selling in the U. S.?
column7: Yes, the recent agreements between the two governments have changed everything.Now we have the right to sell in America at a much lower tariff.It' s going to be good. We can compete more directly with them.
column8: Great.
column9: Our computers have a high level of quality now.We can demonstrate it. And our prices will be good.So I think it will really be worthwhile.
column10: You seem excited about it.
column11: Well, you know I studied marketing in America.So maybe the thought of going back there to promote our brand is kind of exciting to me. I'd love to be part of the team.
column12: Do you honestly think we can compete though? All the computer giants are there.
column13: Yes, I do. I think we can compete. I think we can make a name for ourselves.It will be hard at first. But if we develop a good advertising campaign, I think we can break into the market.
column14: The company will have to choose a good advertising firm.And then there's the problem of quality.How do we convince American buyers that our quality is good?
column15: It takes some time.Because even if the quality is high, people won't accept a high tech product unless they recognize the name.Name recognition is crucial.
column16: Well, I hope it all works out, John. I think if you're part of the team, things will go well.But you know we'd all miss you here. So I won't say I'm happy to think that you're leaving.
column17: That's very nice of you to say.But if we set up an office there in the States, maybe you could try to become part of it.
column18: Me? No way. I'm dedicated to the company, but I'm not going to leave Taiwan. I'm happy here.

column1: What's wrong, Frank?
column2: I didn't make the soccer team.
column3: Cheer up! It's not the end of the world.

column1: Okay. This trail looks the best. It's a little steep. But I'm sure it will be alright.
column2: Well. You're the tour guide, I'll follow you.
column3: ... What a stink. This place stinks like rotten eggs.
column4: That's sulphur you can smell. The whole of Taiwan is a volcanic region. That's why Taiwan has so many hot springs. It's volcanic activity.The sulfur smoke that you can smell is coming from those fumaroles over there.
column5: Suddenly the' great outdoors' isn't so appealing. Let's hike a little faster...

column1: Would you mind taking your feet off the table, Mike?
column2: Not at all. But I've found satisfaction in it!
column3: Do you put your feet on your own table?
column4: No, I never do that.
column5: Why not?
column6: I don't want to mark my table, of course.
column7: Well, will you please put them down?
column8: I'm sorry. I thought you wouldn't come back so early.
column9: I forgot something on the table.
column10: Oh, you've got a good memory.

column1: Good evening. Can I help you?
column2: Yes, I'd like to check in, please. M y name is Peter Wang. I have a reservation for three nights.
column3: Just a moment, please. Oh, yes. One twin and one single. Is that right?
column4: Yes, I'm with my wife and child.
column5: Will you fill out this form, please?

column1: What sort of shopping is nearby, Mr. Taylor?
column2: Call me John. This is a great area of the city for shopping. There ’ s a grocery store just around the corner.
column3: What about things other than food?
column4: Well, the Riverside Mall has 200 stores in it, including four major department stores.
column5: Are there small shops near here as well?
column6: Yes, on 4th street, near the movie theater there are many specialty shops, including clothing boutiques.
column7: Well, that sounds just wonderful.
column8: Yes, it ’ s a really nice neighborhood.

column1: I've just been a little depressed lately.
column2: What's wrong?
column3: Nothing really.
column4: Then just keep your chin up.

column1: Come on, Tara. Let ’ s go up to the window and buy two tickets. The movie is starting in a few minutes.
column2: We can ’ t break into the line. Don ’ t be so impatient. We ’ ll be at the front of the line soon.
column3: Two tickets, please. How much are they?
column4: Oh no, Ari. I didn ’ t mean for you to pay for me when I invited you to go tonight. Let ’ s go Dutch. I ’ ll pay my own way. I insist.
column5: I ’ m looking forward to this film. I read a good review of it in this morning ’ s newspaper.
column6: Me, too. It will be great to see something light and funny for a change. I ’ m tired of heavy drama.
column7: Are these seats okay?
column8: They ’ re fine, but I can ’ t watch a movie without popcorn.

column1: I wonder if you could help me, I'm looking for a room.
column2: Well, I have got a vacancy.
column3: What sort of price are you asking?
column4: Eight dollars fifty a week excluding laundry.
column5: Would it be convenient to see the room?
column6: Can you call back later? We're right in the middle of lunch.

column1: Bob! Your eyes look bloodshot. Did you not sleep well?
column2: I had a drop too much last night. I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine. And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table.
column3: You have it right. Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China. Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship, especially in Northern China.
column4: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me. But if I keep gulping down one cup after another, I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick.
column5: You lose face by refusing to drink, and the host might think you refuse to give him face. The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up. This will endear you to your friends.
column6: A few guys even threw a drunken fit last night, crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood.
column7: Then he must be opening his heart to the friends. In a word, as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort, no one will jeer at you.
column8: I got you. Next time. I'll preface a toast with a statement like' I can't drink any more' and then drink anyway.

column1: Ms. Wang, this is Mr. Cooper, president of Ivy Publishing.
column2: It's nice to meet you, Mr. Cooper.
column3: Nice to meet you, Ms. Wang. You must be exhausted after your long trip from Canada.
column4: Yes, it was quite a long flight. I'm glad to finally be here.

column1: I'm sorry to interrupt you. Please take care not to make a mess while you are selecting goods. If you don't want it, please replace it.
column2: Oh, I'm terribly sorry. but I couldn't find the yoghurt I saw here last time.
column3: What's the brand?
column4: San Yuan.
column5: Oh, it's out of stock at the moment. Why don't you choose another brand instead?
column6: I'm not used to other brands.
column7: You can have a try. Maybe you will like it.
column8: OK. I hope so.

column1: Don't you ever cheat on me.
column2: Why would I do that?
column3: Because men like to cheat.
column4: Some men do, but not me.
column5: I'm watching you.
column6: I'm an open book. Watch me all you want.
column7: If I catch you, you'll be sorry.
column8: You won't catch me, because I love you. I'm not a cheater.
column9: I will poke your eyes out.
column10: I don't want any other woman.
column11: I will chop your toes off, one by one.
column12: Honey, please. You're the only woman for me, forever. I swear it.

column1: How can I help you today?
column2: I am returning something that I bought yesterday.
column3: What would you like to return?
column4: I'm returning a cellphone.
column5: Was there something wrong with it?
column6: It's defective.
column7: What isn't working on it?
column8: It keeps turning off on it's own.
column9: Alright, do you have the receipt?
column10: I have it right here.
column11: I'm going to take care of this and refund your money.
column12: Thanks for your help.

column1: Hi, Mary. I haven't seen you in ages! I heard that you and Daniel are getting married on August 8th, the opening day of the 2008 Olympic Games. Is it true?
column2: yes, it is. We've been dating for over 7 years. We have decided to get married on a special day and we think August 8th, 2008 is a red-letter day.
column3: good for you! It sounds like you've done a lot of planning in a very short time.
column4: yes, there is a lot of to be taken care of---wedding photos, wedding dress, catering, transport, hotel, etc...
column5: is everything ready now?
column6: almost. The only thing that isn't ready is the hotel. As a lot of people have chosen that day to get married, it is hard to find a hotel that isn't too expensive.
column7: have you tried The Peninsula Palace Beijing? My wedding reception was held there and they did an excellent job.
column8: yes, we called, but it is booked up. The only choice is the Regent Beijing but we haven't made up our minds yet.
column9: it's an excellent hotel. A friend of mine had her wedding reception there and said it was perfect, though very expensive.
column10: that's why we want to have a look at other hotels. We don ’ t want to spend too much on an extravagant wedding reception.
column11: I guess you're right. I can help you ask other hotels. I am sure there are probably some available.
column12: thank you.
column13: my pleasure.

column1: What happen, John?
column2: Nothing.
column3: Why do you look unhappy?
column4: I ’ m rather disappointed at not being able to see my best friend off.
column5: Oh, cheer up. He ’ ll understand you.

column1: Do you want to buy something here?
column2: These shoes are great! What is the price of this?
column3: This one is two hundred yuan.
column4: That's too much!

column1: Could I make a reservation for Flight 10 to Tokyo?
column2: I'm sorry, but everything is taken.
column3: How about the next flight-tomorrow at two o'clock?
column4: Yes, I can give you a reservation on that.

column1: There is a problem in my apartment.
column2: What is it?
column3: A pipe broke in my wall, and water is leaking.
column4: Is the water causing any damage?
column5: Yes, it ’ s creating mildew on the walls.
column6: I won ’ t be able to fix the pipe until tomorrow.
column7: I can call a plumber to fix it right now.
column8: I ’ ll do it for you.
column9: Well, you can ’ t do it until tomorrow, and I need it fixed now.
column10: That ’ s true.
column11: You ’ re okay with me calling someone?
column12: I ’ m all right with that.

column1: Guess who I saw yesterday?
column2: Who?
column3: My cousin Monk. Have you seen her lately?
column4: Not for a couple of years. What happened to her?
column5: Nothing exactly. She's grown into a very attractive young lady.
column6: Oh, she is.
column7: You know, her long lovely blond hair and beautiful blue eyes really make her stand out from others.
column8: Not surprising. I bet she's very tall and slim.
column9: Yean. Around five feet five inches tall.

column1: Tiffany, why are more and more people turning to the Web to find a mate?
column2: I think that, as more people use the Internet for both work and pleasure, it makes more sense as a tool to connect with people, and the stigma of meeting someone online is reduced.
column3: There are actually special sites for people looking to date within their specific ethnic group and age group. But how should you screen potential mates? Do you suggest talking to them on the phone right away or communicating via e-mail?
column4: I would say do not make the e-mail exchange too long. A lot of times a connection via e-mail creates almost a false sense of intimacy. Quickly make sure there is a connection in the physical world.
column5: Can you give us any other safety tips for people pursuing relationships on the Net?
column6: I'd suggest you not give out too much personal information, like your home address, until after several dates. Just keep up the same guards you would keep up if you were meeting any stranger.
column7: Besides the growth of these matchmaker sites, do you have any stats on success rates? Are people out there finding true and lasting love through the Internet
column8: Well, for a site like ecrush.com, since their debut in Valentine's Day in 1999, of the 1.5 million people who have joined ecrush.com, 300000 have actually matched.
column9: Do you have any successful stories to share?
column10: Yes, the couple that I highlighted at today's show met on Match.com and they're getting married this summer.

column1: Mom, is there anything in the fridge I can eat before dinner?
column2: There's some leftover pizza from last night.
column3: Anything else?
column4: Um, I think there may be some leftover lasagna from the other day.
column5: Do I have any other choices?
column6: There might be some birthday cake left in the freezer.
column7: Is everything in the fridge leftovers? I hate leftovers!
column8: You can wash the vegetables and cut the chicken and I'll make dinner!

column1: Wow! Look at all these books! I bet I can find a book about anything here!
column2: Shih!! Please keep your voice down. There are people reading and studying here.
column3: Ok, I'm sorry. Are you the librarian? Maybe you can help me, I am looking for a book.
column4: Yes I am. You can check our online catalog to search the book you want based on the genre, title or if you know the author, I can point you towards the right direction.
column5: I am looking for a book that has nursery rhymes.
column6: That would be in our children's section. That book shelf there on the right.
column7: Ok, I would like to check out these books.
column8: Do you have a library card?
column9: No. How do I get one?
column10: I just need to see your drivers license or utility bill to prove that you a resident of this state.
column11: Here you go.
column12: So you are all set. You can have these books for two weeks. If you need to have them longer, you can bring them here to renew them. If you don't, you get charged ten cents a day for each book.
column13: Ok, thanks!

column1: How many people are there in your family?
column2: My immediate family is quite small. It's just my older step-brother, my mom, my step-dad and me. How about you?
column3: I have a large family. I have three older sisters, my twin sister, a younger brother, and my parents.
column4: I didn't know you were a twin! Are you identical or fraternal?
column5: We're identical. I mean, we look exactly the same, but we complete opposites when it comes to everything else!
column6: Interesting. It must be great having a twin sister. Are you best friends, too?
column7: We used to be really close, but that all changed once she moved to Shanghai. How about your family? You didn't mention to your biological father.
column8: I don't know much about him. He died when I was just a baby. Even though I don't have a blood relationship with my step-father and step-brother, I consider them to be my real family.
column9: What about your step-brother's mother? Does he keep in touch with her?
column10: No, she also died when my step-brother was little. My mother and my step-father met each other shortly after my father died and became good friends. They ended up getting married a few years later.
column11: Sounds like it was ment to be.

column1: Saying you want to kill yourself, you terrified me out of my wits.
column2: I was playing a joke on you.
column3: That ’ s too much.
column4: Dear, forgive me. I won ’ t do that again.

column1: Hey, what's up?
column2: Oh, nothing.
column3: What were you writing?
column4: ( Laugh ) All right. You caught me in the act. I finally worked up the nerve to ask Diana out. I was just writing a note to put on her desk.
column5: You mean you're going to ask her out in a note? You big chicken!
column6: I admit it. I'm a wuss. I just can't do it in person.
column7: But, you work with her everyday.
column8: That's different. When I'm working, I'm in a different frame of mind. But, when I even think about asking her out, I get tongue-tied. At least in a note, I can get the words out without turning beet red.
column9: You've dated a lot. What's so different about Diana?
column10: Well, for one thing, she's gorgeous. She's so upbeat and sweet. Who doesn't like her? Oh, I don't know. All I do know is that I think we have great chemistry together. But, what if I'm wrong. Maybe she's just been nice to me out of courtesy and doesn't think of me that way. Oh... forget it. This was a bad idea.
column11: Well, I guess you don't want this note, then.
column12: What note?
column13: I was looking for you to deliver this note from Diana. She wants to know if you want to go to the office party with her tomorrow night.
column14: You're kidding! I can't believe you've been standing this entire time and didn't say anything.
column15: Sorry. What can I say? Now, do you want the note or what?
column16: Yeah, I want the note.
column17: Have a great time tomorrow night.
column18: Thanks. I plan on it.

column1: Harry, do you like the opera?
column2: No, not really.
column3: Why is that? It is called real art.
column4: Well, it's very expensive and they're usually singing in another language. That kind of gets on my nerves.
column5: Yeah, that makes sense.

column1: I've never met anyone like Clyde before.
column2: He's such a buppie-a black yuppie. Black people come in all shapes and sizes. Just check out the party.
column3: Wow! There are so many different people here. I expected mostly athletes and rappers.
column4: You'll find some of those here, too. But not if you don't shake it up! There's an African saying, “ If you can talk, you can sing! If you can walk, you can dance! ”
column5: Then I'll just shut up and sit down!

column1: I hear you and James are engaged at last.
column2: Yes, we are.
column3: When are you getting married?
column4: In the spring.
column5: Oh, lovely.Where' s the wedding going to be?
column6: Well.. we're not sure yet, probably in St.Albans.
column7: Oh, yes, your parents live there, don't they?
column8: Yes, that's right.
column9: Where are you going to live after you're married?
column10: We're going to buy a flat or a small house somewhere in South London.
column11: Are you going to give up your job?
column12: Yes, probably but I may look for another one when we're settled in.

column1: How beautiful the flower is!
column2: Really, it's so beautiful.
column3: You like it. Well, I'll gather in for you.
column4: You mustn't pick it in this place.
column5: Where it is?
column6: It's a private garden.

column1: Who's that over here?
column2: That's the new teacher.
column3: What do you think of the teacher?
column4: She's very nice.
column5: What does she teach?
column6: English, of course.
column7: Is she your teacher?
column8: Yes. She teaches our class three times a week.
column9: Can she speak Chinese to her students?
column10: Not very much.
column11: It's a good thing you can speak English!

column1: Have you heard that Tom and his wife divorced?
column2: I didn't hear that. But I can deduce the reason.
column3: Really? Say it!
column4: Tom is a kind guy, but addicted to gambling. He spends all his time gambling in the casino. And his wife can't put up with his incessant gambling any longer, so she divorced him. Is that right?
column5: Yeah, quite right. Gambling broke up a happy family.
column6: Yeah! Gambling is often a curse. By gambling we lose time and treasure, two things most precious to a man.
column7: Besides that, many people took to gambling and got in over their heads, and gradually ruined themselves.
column8: In a word, gambling is a vice. We should be away from it.

column1: Welcome to our shop. It seems you are interested in this dress.
column2: Yes. But I am afraid it is too thick to wear in summer.
column3: That's no problem. It is made of linen, so you won't feel hot in it. I can assure you it is of superior quality. What is more, it is very popular with young women.
column4: How much is it?
column5: 88 Yuan.
column6: OK, that is reasonable. I will take it.

column1: I really need to start eating healthier.
column2: I have to start eating better too.
column3: What kind of food do you usually eat?
column4: I try my best to eat only fruits, vegetables, and chicken.
column5: Is that really all that you eat?
column6: That's basically it.
column7: How do you stick to only those foods?
column8: Actually, fruits and veggies are really good for you.
column9: Yeah, I know, but what about the chicken?
column10: I mainly eat baked chicken, because there's not a lot of fat.
column11: That does sound pretty good.
column12: I know it does, and that's because it is.

column1: I ’ d like to send this parcel to Australia.
column2: Certainly. Could you put it on the scales, so I can check the weight?
column3: Sure. It ’ s not very heavy.
column4: That ’ s 850 grams. The coasts depends on how you would like to send it.
column5: I see. What are the options? I suppose airmail is faster and more expensive than surface mail.
column6: That ’ s right. Sending it by airmail will cost twelve dollars and sending it by surface mail will cost eight dollars.
column7: How long will it take to get there?
column8: Airmail should take four or five days and surface mail should take about two weeks.
column9: It that case, I ’ ll send it by airmail. I ’ d like to send it as a registered parcel.
column10: No problem. That ’ s one dollar extra.
column11: Thanks very much. There ’ s thirteen dollars.
column12: There ’ s you receipt. Goodbye.

column1: What ’ s the matter, dear?
column2: Something awful happened. We went to the Portobello Road, and someone stole my handbag.
column3: Oh, dear. Did you lose a lot of money?
column4: No. Only a few pounds. But my passport was in the bag. That ’ what I ’ m really worry about.
column5: You must tell the embassy about it. And I think they ’ ll issue you with a new one.
column6: I ’ d better go tomorrow.
column7: No. But you mustn ’ t leave it too long. Did you report it the police?

column1: I am sorry. I didn ’ t accomplish the job on time.
column2: That ’ s all right. Everyone feels under the weather sometimes. Just finish the rest when you feel well.

column1: Yes, sir. May I help you?
column2: Please I'd like a ticket to New York.
column3: For today?
column4: No, early saturday morning.
column5: We have a flight that we'll put you there at ten AM. Is that ok?
column6: Nothing earlier? I prefer flight at 9 thirty.
column7: I'm afraid not, unless you want a night flight.
column8: No, exactly not.
column9: How about afternoon?
column10: Sounds not good. I won't take it.

column1: It smells like an ashtray in here!
column2: Hi honey! What ’ s wrong? Why do you have that look on your face?
column3: What ’ s wrong? I thought we agreed that you were gonna quit smoking.
column4: No! I said I was going to cut down which is very different. You can ’ t just expect me to go cold turkey overnight!
column5: Look, there are other ways to quit. You can try the nicotine patch, or nicotine chewing gum. We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month and now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place. It ’ s not like you can just light up like before.
column6: I know, I know. I am trying but, I don ’ t have the willpower to just quit. I can ’ t fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch! Please understand?
column7: Fine! I want a divorce!

column1: I'm so glad that the spring festival is near at hand.

column6: Such as...
column7: You know why fire crackers are set off in festival.
column8: Why? to welcome the new year of course.
column9: And also to frighten away evil spirits.
column10: Really?

column12: Oh, that's why my parents never scold me that day. they always try to avoid tears and quarrels.

column3: I'll make it up to you. Let me know how much it costs and I'll give you the money.

column1: I swear I will never shop at a street market in China. It's a terrible place full of excellent profiteers! You have to keep an eye whenever it comes to paying for something.
column2: cool down, Harry! What are you really mad about? Did you get ripped off?
column3: yes. Last Sunday I went to a nearby market. It was on open-air fair. I chanced upon this bag and bought it on the spot, without even trying to strike a bargain. I paid one hundred and twenty. And just now I was told by my Chinese colleagues I bought it overpriced. I could have talked my way to thirty.
column4: is that so? I'm afraid people here will not take pity on unlucky guys like you. Bargaining has always been an indispensable procedure in business deals. It's the norm of free trade. The seller sets a preposterous price, and the buyer tries his best to bring it down, until a compromise is reached. Yet you ignored the process. No wonder you ended up easy prey.
column5: but don't you think it annoying to overcharge the customers by such a handsome margin?
column6: of course, that's something really irritating. And the only way to avoid being trapped is to know in advance about the real worth of the stuff. I recommend you to consult the price tags in the supermarket first. And then you may negotiate for a fair deal.

column7: When will we know if they accept the offer?
column8: The owners usually respond to an offer within a few days.
column9: Should I be contacting my bank in the meantime?
column10: You are already pre-qualified for your loan, so you are in good shape.

column1: It's amazing to me how international business has become. Take my store for example. On any given day, you will find imported items from more than 20 different countries on our shelves.
column2: How many different varieties of products do you import from China?
column3: China provides the bulk of our product inventory, for sure. We import more than 40 different items from China. Most of the imports that come out of China are low-grade plastics or toys. Japan produces many electronic exports, Germany produces excellent mechanical exports.
column4: Do you import any food items?
column5: Generally speaking, food items are difficult to import. Food with the short shelf life is liable to spoil in the time it takes to ship from one place to another. The only food items we import are specialty canned or preserved foods. The shelf life is longer for these products.

column4: Shower, please.
column5: All right. The fitting room is over there.
column6: How much should I pay?
column7: $ 100. But we will charge you $ 200 as a deposit.

column1: We came too early. There're still three hours before the performance starts.

column3: Never mind. What about taking a look around the theater?
column4: Why not? I'd love to do that.

column7: Not really. They are just opera costumes. Do you like the embroidery?
column8: I surely do. They must have had advanced machines in ancient China to do that.
column9: No, no, no. They are all handmade, girl. You know, the ancient Chinese women were supposed to be good at needlework.
column10: Unbelievable! I could never do that.
column11: Very few can. That's why these clothes only appear in the museum.
column12: Listen! Some people are singing outside. Is it the opera?

column15: Follow me. Make sure not to interrupt them.
column16: Of course not. We don't do that.

column4: A driver ’ s license or something showing that you live in this city.

column10: It ’ ll be mailed to you within two weeks, but you can borrow books on the temporary card.

column6: Not at all. I see you and your family twice a week, and I enjoy seeing my own friends. I ’ m too busy to feel lonely!

column6: Economy, please.
column7: That would be 346 Euro.
column8: OK. Could I make a reservation?
column9: Certainly. Which flight would you like?
column10: The 16:45, please.
column11: Could I have your name, please?

column13: How would you like to pay, Ms. Jones?
column14: Can I pay at the check-in desk when I pick up my ticket?
column15: Yes, but you will have to confirm this reservation at least two hours before departure time.
column16: I see.
column17: Now you have been booked, Ms. Jones. The flight leaves at 16:45, and your arrival in Sydney will be at 9:00 a. m., local time. The flight number is NWA 476.
column18: Thank you.

column1: Your tree looks beautiful. Do you decorate it this way every year?
column2: Yes, it's a family tradition dating back to my childhood. We use the same lights and ornaments, but of course we have a new tree each year.The children made some of these decorations. Here, you can hang this on one of those high branches.
column3: Well, everything seems to be just about ready. Now all we need is snow.Do you exchange the presents in the morning?

column5: And we'll have a great turkey dinner at around four o'clock. My brother and his family will be joining us. I look forward to meeting them. Well, it's late, so I'll say good night. I'll see you early tomorrow, so I can share your Christmas morning.Good night!

column1: Excuse me. Can you tell me how to get started using these machines?
column2: Of course. Are you a new member here?
column3: Yes.
column4: Welcome. My name is Johnson.
column5: Nice to meet you.
column6: Do you have any experience using weights?
column7: No, I don't. So I need some help.
column8: Well, first it is important to go through a good stretch.You must warm up properly so that you don't hurt yourself on the machines.
column9: Yes, I know that.Derek just led me through the warm up in the aerobics room.So I'm ready, I think. I can start using the machines.
column10: Alright. Great. Then we must get a card for you.
column11: What do you mean--a membership card? I already have one.
column12: No. Not that. I mean a training card.The card allows you to keep track of how much weight you use on each machine.Here, let me show you.
column13: I'm ready.
column14: Now, you can see that on this card there are all the machines listed.So, when you go through the series of twelve machines, you enter in the number of repetitions you do.And you also enter in the weight at which you set the machine.
column15: I see. So this card helps me to keep track of my progress.
column16: Yes. And it also reminds you what is a suitable weight for each machine.Today, I will go through the machines with you one by one. I will show you how to use them.And we will determine what is a good starting weight for you.
column17: Alright. Great.
column18: So you write your name and member number at the top of the card.And then, after you exercise each time, you file the card here.
column19: Great. Why don't we start on the machines?
column20: Are you alright? Can you do more?
column21: I'm sorry. I know there are still seven machines. But I'm exhausted.
column22: That's okay. Don't worry.It' s important not to push yourself. Especially not at the beginning.
column23: What can I do though? I don't know the proper settings for the rest of the machines.
column24: We can just go through them next time. It's no problem. Really.The most important thing is to know your limits.So if you feel burned out now, it is good to stop.Because if you strain a muscle or hurt your back, then you won't be able to exercise for a couple weeks. Right?
column25: Yes. I suppose it's best to stop.

column1: Hello! How are you.
column2: Not too well! I ’ m just to the doctor. I haven ’ t been feeling too well over the last few days.
column3: What have you got? A cough? A cold?
column4: That ’ s the funny thing. I don ’ t what ’ s wrong with me. I just feel exhausted.
column5: Perhaps you ’ Ve been working too hard. You do have a high-pressure job.
column6: Maybe. I haven ’ t been able to keep my food down either. That ’ s unusual.
column7: Well. I ’ m sure the doctor will be able to prescribe something to make you well again. Dr. Jameson is very good.
column8: Yes, he is. I ’ Ve make an appointment for 10 o ’ clock, so I ’ d better move along.
column9: OK. Hope you feel better soon. You should take it easy. I ’ m sure the doctor will prescribe rest, you know.

column1: Joanne, let ’ s not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is, okay? Let ’ s just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly, so we can go our separate ways, alright?
column2: Fine with me. I just want to get this over with. It ’ s important we make a clean break. I should have signed a pre-nup.
column3: What was that?
column4: Nothing! Anyway, you ’ re right, there ’ s no reason this has to be nasty. My lawyer tells me you ’ Ve accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property, as well as the custody agreement-I keep the cat and you get the dog. So that ’ s done... finally.
column5: Let ’ s not go there, Joanne! Ok, so let ’ s start with the record collection, I ’ ll take the albums I contributed and you can have your cheesy disco albums back.
column6: Fine, but I ’ m keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
column7: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us, Joanne. And you hardly ever use it!
column8: He ’ s my grandfather, and he never really liked you anyway!
column9: Whatever! Alright, I ’ ll concede the silly gramophone, if you ’ ll agree that I get the silver tea set.
column10: How typical, when are you ever going to use a silver tea set? Fine! I don ’ t want to drag this out any longer than necessary. What ’ s next? What about these old photographs?
column11: Which ones? Let me have a look. Wow, look at that! That brings back memories... That?
column12: Our trip to Italy! I remember that day. We were going to visit the Trev fountain, and we got caught in the rain...
column13: ... and you looked so adorable with your hair all wet. I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley, smiling and laughing in the rain...
column14: Oh, we really did have fun back then, didn ’ t we?
column15: Oh, Joanne, are we making a big mistake? I know our relationship has been on the rocks for sometime but are you sure we can ’ t reconcile and try again? I still love you.
column16: Oh Jeff! I love you too! I ’ m so glad we didn ’ t have to decide who keeps the motorcycle.
column17: The motorcycle? But that ’ s mine!

column1: Have some more tea, George.
column2: No, thanks. I've really got to go now.
column3: Have a nice day!
column4: You, too.

column4: It doesn ’ t matter. Go back the way you came. After about five kilometers, you ’ ll see a hotel on the side of the road. It ’ s a big one. You can ’ t miss it.

column1: Diana, in your opinion, which is more important, IQ or EQ?
column2: Why are you asking me the strange question, Jerry?
column3: I watched the movie Forrest Gump last night. And the question just lined in my mind.
column4: Well. I think IQ matters more. But it won't work without EQ.
column5: Why? You seem pretty sure about it.
column6: Because an intellectual mind can only be a beneficial thing in life.
column7: But IQ is decided at birth.One can't expect to make a lot of improvement in it.
column8: That's why people's achievement varies greatly.
column9: That' s true, but what if one comes across some difficulties. He must rely on his EQ to deal with them.
column10: Yes, Jerry, can you share your understanding of EQ?
column11: I think it is independent of IQ and plays a prominent role in deciding the way we live our lives.
column12: Quite right. Have you noticed that a high IQ is not a must for one's success?
column13: Just as Forrest?
column14: Yes, his IQ is high enough for him to embrace the success as long as he can manage his EQ.
column15: I got it.

column1: Hi, Tony. Haven ’ t seen you for a long time. How have you been?
column2: OK, I ’ Ve been looking for a job for days, and I haven ’ t found one yet. It's so hard finding work these days. Have you had any luck?
column3: Yes, I've got a job, a waiter's job in a restaurant.
column4: Are you well paid?
column5: Well, $ 10 per hour, but I can keep the tips. That comes to roughly $ 80 every evening
column6: Not bad.
column7: Actually, there's still another opening. If you are interested, you ’ ll surely get it.
column8: That ’ s great! I ’ ll go there right now and speak with the boss.
column9: There ’ s no rush. You can see him tomorrow. I ’ Ve told him about you. He promised to give you the job.
column10: That was nice of you, Susan. Thanks a lot.
column11: Think nothing of it, Tony. I ’ m sure you ’ d do the same for me.
column12: Could you tell me a bit more about the work there? I mean, those dos and don'ts. I am a green hand, you know.
column13: First of all, you must be punctual. You should be there before 6 p. m. so that you will have half an hour for preparation changing clothes and things like that. Then, remember you should smile. Smile to your customers all the time. Never pull a long face even If you feel awful that day. Anything else? Oh, yes. Never argue with your boss. Learn to say' Yes, sir.'
column14: Be a yes-man, you mean?
column15: You may put it that way if you like. Don ’ t worry. You ’ ll have no problem.
column16: I hope not.

column3: it's always rather congested down there during rush hour. Maybe you should try to find a different route to get home.
column4: I don't think it can be avoided, to be honest.
column5: perhaps it would be better if you started taking public transport system to work.

column7: it would be better for the environment, too.

column9: taking the subway would be a lot less stressful than driving as well.

column11: well, when it's nicer outside, you can start biking to work. That will give you just as much freedom as your car usually provides.
column12: that's true. I could certainly use the exercise!
column13: so, are you going to quit driving to work then?
column14: yes, it's not good for me or for the environment.

column1: Howdy! Nice car! What seems to be the problem?
column2: I don ’ t know! This stupid old car started spewing white smoke and it just died on me. Luckily, I managed to start it up and drive it here. What do you think it is?
column3: Not sure yet.How about you pop the hood and we can take a look. Mmmm, it doesn ’ t look good.
column4: What do you mean? My daddy gave me this car for my birthday last month. It ’ s brand new!
column5: Well missy, the white smoke that you saw is steam from the radiator. You overheated your engine so now the pistons are busted and so is your transmission. You should have called us and we could have towed you over here when your car died.
column6: Ugh... So how long is this going to take? An hour?
column7: I ’ m afraid a bit more than that. We need to order the spare parts, take apart your electrical system, fuel pump and engine and then put it back together again. You are going to have to leave it here for at least two weeks.
