column1: Here is your ticket. Let's get in the museum.
column2: Sure. The exhibits on display were really fascinating.
column3: I can't agree more. I think we'd better hire a guide so that we can learn more.
column4: Good idea. Let's ask the officer for help.

column1: May I come in?
column2: Yeah, Please do. Now let me show you the house.
column3: This seems a pretty nice room, I should say.
column4: You bet. This is the nicest room in the district. You know what, I just had all the walls repainted last month.
column5: What about the kitchen?
column6: It's a well furnished eat-in kitchen. The stove and the ice-box are in good order, and the plumbing is OK, too.
column7: I see. I'd like to live here for about three years.
column8: Terrific! When are you moving in?
column9: Next Saturday at the earliest.

column1: I want to get on the bus already.
column2: It just isn't on time today.
column3: It was supposed to be here thirty minutes ago.
column4: I think it'll be here pretty soon.
column5: I need to get to work, so it better.
column6: I really do hate public transportation.
column7: I agree, it's just never on time.
column8: That's right.
column9: I also hate having to stand at a bus stop in all kinds of weather.
column10: Oh, that's the worst.
column11: We need to get a car.
column12: I completely agree with that.

column1: Has the chief accepted our plan?
column2: Not yet. I guess we should send Jim along to talk to the chief since he is such an apple polisher. I am sure he can help.
column3: Let ’ s have a try.

column1: What are you doing this Saturday?
column2: Not much.
column3: Do you want to go see a movie?
column4: That sounds good.
column5: What's playing at the Century Fox?
column6: Candlelight in the Window
column7: Should we go see it?
column8: I'd rather not. I don't like horror movies.
column9: How about ‘ Run of the Mill? ’
column10: No. I heard that's really boring.
column11: Why don't we go to a concert instead?
column12: Great idea!

column1: What do you do in your spare time?
column2: During the weekend I often take the family out on short trips.
column3: That sounds interesting.
column4: Yes, it helps me to relax.
column5: Do you have any hobbies?
column6: I like to paint. 
column7: What kind of things do you paint?
column8: Mainly seascapes.
column9: What kinds of sports do you like?
column10: I like almost all sports, and I enjoy both playing and watching. I especially like tennis and mountain climbing. I was in the climbing club all through school.

column1: Hey, how are you doing?
column2: Could you do me a favor?
column3: Sure, whatever you need.
column4: Can you help me move this table?

column1: Please help yourself to whatever you like, don't be shy.
column2: Yes, thank you. I ’ Ve already been helping myself.
column3: This dish tastes terrific. Would you like to try a little? It is a little hot, but very good.
column4: I like hot food, especially Sichuan cuisine.
column5: Would you like another beer?
column6: I'II have another cup of beer insist. I know I don't like to drink alone, especially there are someone sitting there next to me.
column7: Come on, it's the weekend. Let's taste and enjoy this meal. Cheers!
column8: Bottom's up, and you're right. This meal is incredible. I wish I had known this restaurant before. Thanks for bringing me here. I know I'll be back soon.

column1: Hello everyone, and welcome to our CPR for beginners course.First of all, does anyone know what CPR stands for?
column2: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation!
column3: That ’ s right! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
column4: What does that mean?
column5: Well, basically if your heart stops pumping blood, or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again! That ’ s when we have to apply this procedure. Let ’ s begin! I need a volunteer.
column6: Me! Me!
column7: Alright, come here and lay flat on your back. Let ’ s suppose this young woman has stopped breathing. We must lift the person ’ s chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs. Then we place our mouth over the other person ’ s mouth and blow air two or three times, like this.
column8: Wait, what are you doing? I ’ m a married woman! You can ’ t just try to kiss me like this!
column9: Madam I ’ m not trying to kiss you! I am trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
column10: Well, OK. But no French kissing!
column11: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner. Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again. To do this, we place our hands over the person ’ s chest, and press down firmly two or three times.
column12: Wait, what are you doing! You can ’ t just kiss me then go for second base!

column1: Dad, you keep talking about family in New Zealand. Who are they?
column2: Well, that's your uncle Bill, his wife and two of their daughters.
column3: Is uncle Bill your brother?
column4: No, your uncle Jack is my brother, Bill is my brother-in-law, your mom's brother.
column5: So his two daughters are my cousins?
column6: That's right, Sarah and Jane are both your cousins although they are step-sisters.
column7: What are step-sisters?
column8: Sarah is your uncle Bill's older daughter. When she was young, Bill's first wife, Sarah's mom died. Three years later Bill married again.
column9: So uncle Bill's wife is Jane's mother but not Sarah's mother. Right?
column10: Yes. She is Sarah's step-mother.
column11: And when are they coming to visit us?
column12: They want to travel to Europe next year, and will visit us at the same Ae.

column1: What is that plastic cup for?
column2: Your doctor has requested a urine sample.
column3: Am I supposed to pee into the cup?
column4: We want what we call a clean sample. Urinate a drop or so into the toilet, and then stop the flow and urinate into the cup.
column5: Then what do I do with the cup?
column6: You put the cup in the little cubby in the restroom and close the door to the cubby.
column7: What is this test for?
column8: He is looking to see if you have a bladder or urinary tract infection.
column9: When will I know the results?
column10: Your doctor will call you in a few days with the results.

column1: Welcome, young man. No offence, but I haven't seen you here before.
column2: Of course, this is my first time here. My Mom has a membership here. Here is the card.
column3: Okay then. You are the younger customer here ever.
column4: It's not so wise that you do not explore the children's market.
column5: It's the marketing's fault, I suppose.What do you want to do?
column6: Well, I want to become just like Bruce Lee. What should I do?
column7: That's a long way to go, I'm afraid. First of all, you gotta grow up.
column8: I am still young. And I'm growing every minute.
column9: Sure. Then what about trying the treadmill or the skipping rope.
column10: I love running. Anything else?
column11: Please change your clothes first!
column12: I'm perfect with my clothes. And I do not have anything else with me.
column13: Sorry, but no jeans here.
column14: Oh, that's the only place where jeans are not popular. I'd better just go home.

column1: Shall we go for a drive today?
column2: It feels like there's going to be rain later.
column3: Maybe you're right.
column4: We'll go tomorrow.

column1: if you can choose, will you marry a foreigner or a Chinese?
column2: why? Did tom pop the question?
column3: not yet. But I wonder if I can get my parents ’ consent.
column4: let me guess, your parents want you to marry a Chinese man, right?
column5: you are right. It is giving me a real headache. I feel like I ’ m between a rock and a hard place.
column6: I used to have the same problem when I was with my ex.
column7: oh, how did you deal with it?
column8: I just let it go and continued dating with my Korean boyfriend. But finally we broke up.
column9: oh, it ’ s a pity. What was the matter?
column10: simple. We had personality clashes and there were too many cultural differences.
column11: like what?
column12: he hoped to live in the Korean way and asked me to give up working and stay at home to take care of the family.
column13: Oh, I see. In their culture women should put family first.
column14: yes, he said it would be batter for me and for the whole family. But I simply can not quit working.
column15: so that's why it ’ s hard to have a happy marriage with a foreigner.
column16: not really. There are many successful mixed marriage around us.

column1: Listen, Karen, I need your help. I don't know anyone here yet.
column2: I'm glad to help you. What's wrong?
column3: My mother-in-law just went into the hospital in L.A.Hank and I will be flying there tonight.
column4: I'm sorry to hear it. What's wrong with her?
column5: Doctors aren't sure yet.But the real problem is Suzy. She has a bad cold, and we don't want to take her with us. But we don't know who can stay with her.
column6: You need a babysitter.
column7: Yes, I'd ask Jill, the girl I've had before, but I need someone overnight.Maybe even for two nights.
column8: I could have Suzy stay at my place.
column9: I don't want to do that to you, Karen.
column10: Why not?
column11: Your own kids would get Suzy's cold. I think it would be better to have a good babysitter here. But I don't know who to ask. I need someone more mature than Jill. It might even be for two or three days.
column12: I know who we can ask. There is a girl I know, Sara Ralston.She is 17, and she will usually take this kind of job. I know her from my church, and I trust her completely.
column13: I'd like to talk with her.This is short notice, I know. But Hank and I are leaving tonight.
column14: I'll get you her number. I hope she can do it. She is very responsible.
column15: I'm glad you know someone. I knew you would be the best person to ask about this. I don't want to insult Jill or her mother. I think Jill maybe could do it.But I'd rather have someone a little older.
column16: I'll go home and get Sara's number. I'll call her first myself.
column17: Great. Then call me and let me know if she's free.

column1: Can you help me pick out a gift for my daughter?
column2: She might like a laptop computer.
column3: Yes, that sounds like a good idea.
column4: Might I suggest a Mac?
column5: Okay. How much?
column6: Well, a 15 - inch Pro is $ 2,100.
column7: Oh, that sounds great. I'll take it.
column8: Great. How would you like to pay for it?
column9: Here's my VISA.
column10: Let me ring you up. Okay, sign here, please.
column11: Everything I need is in this box?
column12: It'll take her only a few minutes to get online.
column13: Thank you for your help.
column14: So long. Thank you for shopping here.

column1: What did you do last night?
column2: I just stayed at home and watched TV.
column3: Did you watch the Barcelona versus Madrid game?
column4: Yes, it was a very evenly matched game.
column5: What were the results of the game?
column6: It ended in a tie.
column7: What was the actual score?
column8: It was three all.
column9: Really? I thought Barcelona was going to win. They are a much better team than Madrid.
column10: If Barcelona had played as they normally do, they should have won.
column11: What happened?
column12: Their goalkeepers got injured after the first goal, but he kept on playing anyway.
column13: That explains it.
column14: How many more games are left this season?
column15: That was the last game before the playoffs.
column16: When do the playoffs start?
column17: In a few weeks. Are you planning on watching them?
column18: Of course! I really love watching football games on TV.
column19: Me, too! Do you want to come over and watch the next game at my place? I'm planning on having a few people over to watch it together.

column1: How is night life in Beijing?
column2: Very interesting!
column3: What do you suggest then?
column4: How about going to dance? There is a very good nightclub nearby.
column5: That's a great idea. Let's go... Oh, the dance hall looks very nice and the music is wonderful.
column6: I'm glad you like it.The band is called " Four and One ". They are especially good at playing rock and roll.
column7: That's great! I love to dance to fast music.
column8: Then you must be interested in disco dancing, aren't you?
column9: Yes, disco dancing is my favorite.It' s great fun and good exercise as well.
column10: OK. Let's disco.
column11: Now the band is playing a slow dance.
column12: That's a waltz. Would you like to try it?
column13: Sorry, I think I'Il sit out the next dance.
column14: All right. Let me get you something to drink.

column1: I would like to order a waistcoat.
column2: Have you chosen the material?
column3: Yes, I want it to made of tweed.
column4: Fine. And the charge is $ 100.
column5: When will it be available?
column6: Next Wednesday.

column1: Could you please stop flipping the channels?
column2: I ’ m very sorry.

column1: Nurse, I am sure to die soon. They just don't tell me the truth, I know.
column2: But I don't think so. No one has ever said a word that you are to die, only yourself. That means you are not willing to die, right? Actually, you are recovering and what you imagine as your worry is slowing down the treatment. Many cases worse than yours turned out to be hopeful and successful. You must be confident. Your condition is much better physically, but a little bi difficult mentally. The most important thing for you now is cooperation with us.
column3: Is what you said really true?
column4: Of course. I am a nurse and a nurse tells the truth.
column5: Thank you.

column1: The last thing I want to see is to lose face before my friends.
column2: That ’ s really unbearable.
column3: But you know, things cannot always go as you expect.
column4: So get prepared for everything.

column1: Excuse me. Is anyone sitting here?
column2: No, nobody.
column3: You don ’ t mind if I smoke, do you?
column4: Well, to be frank, yes, I do.
column5: Oh, I ’ m sorry. But this isn ’ t a no-smoker, isn ’ t it? I mean would you mind if I smoke here?
column6: Actually it is. Perhaps you haven ’ t noticed the sign.
column7: Sign? What ’ s sign?
column8: There, on the window.
column9: Oh, sorry. I didn ’ t notice it. Sorry.
column10: That ’ s all right.

column1: Excuse me, I'm looking for the airport bus stop. Do you know where it is?
column2: Here it is.
column3: When does the bus come?
column4: You just missed one.
column5: How about the next one?
column6: In an hour.
column7: Isn't there an earlier one?
column8: No, they come every hour on the hour.
column9: Thank you very much.
column10: You are welcome.

column1: Is there a train leaving for Philadelphia?
column2: Yeah. There's an express that leaves in twenty minutes.
column3: May I buy a ticket here at the station?
column4: Sure.
column5: Where?
column6: Go to window number eleven.
column7: Thanks.

column1: So, got any more ideas for the website ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: But we registered at Macy's. People can just buy gifts there.
column4: The Taiwanese won't have time to buy gifts in America. The chat room is more convenient.
column5: You're right. They can discuss what to get and avoid buying the same things.
column6: Or discuss what gifts they could buy together.
column7: Any other ideas?
column8: We can also put a guest book on the website for people to sign and write comments.
column9: And we were going to make a collage for each of us using our baby pictures...
column10: Yeah, that will be the best part. Jack hasn't seen yours yet, right?

column1: Are you going out again?
column2: Yes, I'm going to the cinema, dad.
column3: You mustn't go to bed very late. Can you be home before nine.
column4: Oh, I won't be back so early. The film will be over at nine. Can I have the key to the bicycle?
column5: No. I won't let you ride a bicycle late at night.
column6: Oh, dad, I'm not a child. I'm 17 already. I'll come back as soon as the film is over.
column7: OK. Here's the key. Take care.
column8: I will. Thank you, dad.

column1: Excuse me, what's the charge for a picture?
column2: $ 1. You can get your photos instantly.
column3: That's great. Give me the landscape of the Triumphal for the background.
column4: No problem. Say' cheese'. That's good. Please wait a moment.

column1: Can you help me please?
column2: Certainly sir.
column3: Do you know if there is Japanese restaurant near the hotel?
column4: Actually there ’ s one on the same street as this hotel.
column5: Is it far?
column6: Not at all. Turn left out of the hotel and it's about a five minute walk.

column1: Can you do push-ups?
column2: Of course I can. It's a piece of cake! Believe it or not, I can do 30 push-ups a minute.
column3: Really? I think that's impossible!
column4: You mean 30 push-ups?
column5: Yeah!
column6: It's easy. If you do exercise everyday, you can make it, too.

column1: Hi, Francis, how was your business trip?
column2: It was a nightmare.
column3: What ’ s up?
column4: Actually, the business trip itself was very successful. We arrived on time, we had nice conversations and we settled some important issues for the next year.
column5: Sounds quite fruitful, why do you call it still a nightmare then?
column6: Well, the air line lost my luggage on the return flight and then I lost my carry on bag when I was tackling with the officers in charge. I left the airport three hours later than I expected and then I was caught in a traffic jam. When I finally got home, I was totally exhausted. But I found the elevator was out of service due to a blackout.
column7: This is really a sad story. Did they trace back your luggage?
column8: I am still waiting for their call.
column9: Take it easy, all sufferings have their reward.

column1: Good morning, Miss.
column2: Good morning. Could you tell me where I can find the Clothing Department?
column3: On the left of the elevator of the 3rd floor.
column4: I ’ d like to buy a woolen vest for my grandpa.
column5: I ’ m sure you can find your favorite there.
column6: Thank you very much.
column7: It ’ s my honor.

column1: I ’ Ve got this really neat idea, you can hire a car and drive straight there.
column2: Are you nuts? What would my friends think if they see me in a hired car?
column3: But that ’ s the quickest way to make your plans work.
column4: Oh this is hard! Well, I ’ ll see what I can do.

column1: Excuse me. Can I open a postal savings account in your office?
column2: Of course. What kind of postal savings account do you want to open?
column3: Hum.. Can you recommend me one with high interest?
column4: OK. We offer a few different kinds of postal saving services. They have different interest rates.
column5: I want the one with the highest interest rate.
column6: That would be our Savers Plus account. You must pay 10 000 yuan into your deposit account. In this way you can get 5 % dividend at the end of the year.
column7: All right. I'II open this one.
column8: Just fill out these forms, and I ’ ll be with you in one second.
column9: Thanks.

column1: We are here.
column2: OK. How much is the fare?
column3: The total is 45 yuan.
column4: 45 yuan? It is too much, Are you sure?
column5: It is 45 yuan on the meter.
column6: Is there something wrong with your meter?
column7: No. I am sure about that.
column8: OK. Could you give me a receipt?
column9: Yes. This is your receipt.

column1: Welcome back, soccer fans. My name is Rick Fields and, as always, I am joined by my commentating wingman, Bob Copeland.
column2: And we ’ re on the brink of soccer history today, as Ecuador and Brazil are tied one-one as we begin the second half of the 2022 World Cup!
column3: The ref calls the players for the kick off, and here we go! Ecuador quickly passes the ball to the midfield, but, oath, it ’ s out of bounds.
column4: That will be a throw in for Brazil. Adriano has the ball and makes a long pass to Robin, and the ref has called him offside.
column5: No question about it. He was offside by a mile! We have a goal kick for Ecuador. Edison Mendez heads it to Valencia, he shoots! Deflected by the defender and we have a corner kick.
column6: Delgado takes the corner. We have a foul! Oh no, Did, the goalkeeper, has fouled the Ecuadorian player! He gets a yellow card and that will be a penalty kick!
column7: This is the perfect opportunity for Ecuador to get ahead in this match and become World Champions! He gets ready for the kick. He shoots! and he...

column1: I hear you have just shown your hand first to Lin Ping.
column2: Yes.
column3: If I were in your position, I wouldn't give up an inch.
column4: I regret to say I can't accept your suggestion.

column1: Can you pick up some things from the store for me?
column2: Of course, what do you need?
column3: I need a few things, I'll give you the list.
column4: Is there something else you need that you can think of?
column5: Everything I need is on the list.
column6: Do you want me to make any other stops while I'm out?
column7: Since you asked, would you pick up my medicine from the pharmacy?
column8: Is it ready to be picked up?
column9: I believe so.
column10: No problem. I'll do that for you.
column11: I really appreciate you doing this for me.
column12: It's no problem at all.

column1: Good morning, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: I'm Bill. I'm in Room 908. Can you change the room for me? It's too noisy. My wife was woken up several times by the noise the baggage elevator made. She said it was too much for her.
column3: I'm awfully sorry, sir. I do apologize. Room 908 is at the end of the corridor. It's possible that the noise is heard early in the morning when all is quiet.
column4: Anyhow, I'd like to change our room.
column5: No problem, sir. We'll manage it, but we don't have any spare room today. Could you wait till tomorrow? The American People-to-people Education Delegation will be leaving tomorrow morning. There'll be some rooms for you to choose from.
column6: All right. I hope we'll be able to enjoy our stay in a quiet suite tomorrow evening and have a sound sleep.
column7: Be sure. I'll make a note of that. Everything will be taken care of. And if there is anything more you need, please let us know.

column1: Room reservations. Can I help you?
column2: Hello, is there a room available?
column3: What kind of room do you have in mind?
column4: A twin room, please.
column5: Hold on, please.... I'm afraid we're fully booked.The only room available at the moment is a suite.
column6: Oh, I see. Thank you anyway.

column1: Good afternoon, Johnson.
column2: Good afternoon, Mary. How's business?
column3: Not bad, thanks.

column1: Madison Suites, how may I help you?
column2: Yes, I'm calling from Mexico. I will be in town next week and would like to know if you have availability.
column3: OK ma'am, can you tell me the date you expect to check in?
column4: Yes, July ninth. I will be there for seven nights.
column5: We have a junior single suite or a superior double suite available for those dates.
column6: What's the difference?
column7: The junior suite is smaller and has one twin bed, while the superior suite has a double bed and mini-bar.
column8: OK, I would like to reserve the superior suite. Is breakfast included?
column9: Yes, a buffet breakfast is served every morning. I will need your name and your credit card details in order to complete the reservation.
column10: Sure, my credit card number is...

column1: Hi Barbara. Have you lost weight?
column2: Hi Julie. Yeah. I've been on a diet for a couple of months now.
column3: Wow. You look great.
column4: Thanks for noticing.
column5: What type of diet were you on?
column6: I joined a health club and my trainer gave me tips on eating. With a combination of eating better and exercising, I managed to lose 15 pounds in 2 months.
column7: That's amazing. What tips did your trainer give you?
column8: Mostly on how to exercise, but the best advice I got was changing my eating habits. Instead of eating 3 times a day, she told me to eat 5 times a day.
column9: That doesn't make sense. If you eat more, than how do you lose weight?
column10: Actually, I'm eating the same amount. I eat 5 smaller meals a day. Basically, it naturally speeds up the metabolism and helps to burn fat at a faster rate.
column11: That makes sense. I'm going to try that.
column12: You don't need to lose weight.
column13: I have a little gut I have been trying to get rid of.
column14: Ah... but remember to incorporate a little exercise into your diet.
column15: Thanks for the advice.
column16: No problem.

column1: How are you getting along with your paper?
column2: I haven't finished it. It is very difficult.
column3: You should hand it in before next Sunday.
column4: Oh, I know. I will try my best.
column5: I believe you can do a good job.

column1: How do you feel about this restaurant?
column2: I really liked it!
column3: I really enjoyed the food.
column4: What did you enjoy the most?
column5: I enjoyed the fish the most.
column6: The fish was pretty special, but I loved the dessert.
column7: The macadamia cake was out-of-this-world!
column8: I really felt that the service was exceptionally good.
column9: Yes, the service really added to the experience.
column10: I am looking forward to returning to this restaurant.

column1: Have you seen this news article? Apparently an organization has made a list to name the new seven wonders of the world and people could vote for them online.
column2: Wow, that's really interesting. So who won?
column3: Well, the Great Wall of China, the Taj Mahal in India.
column4: I've been there! It really is an amazing work of architecture and art. The entire complex is made of white marble and in the interior of the tomb, the walls are covered with gems and emeralds!
column5: Cool! Also amongst the winners is Petra, in Jordan, Mach Pitch in Peru and the pyramid in Chichenitza in Mexico.
column6: Wait a minute! It also says that the Christ Re-deemer statue in Brazil and the Colosseum in Rome are wonders. I would love to go to Italy and see the Colosseum, stand in the middle like a gladiator!
column7: Well, let's see if we can find some cheap airfare and we can go towards the end of the year.
column8: Good idea!

column1: I ’ m Miss Sherman. What seems to be the problem?
column2: Well, apparently I ’ Ve run up quite a bill. I was under the impression that the Junior Executive Holiday Package only cost 250 dollars per night. I ’ Ve just been informed that it ’ s actually 500 do
column3: That ’ s true. For the Junior Executive Room... three nights... yes, your bill should be $ 1,500
column4: But I definitely was led to believe that a three-night stay would be $ 750.
column5: The advertised rate is based on double occupancy.
column6: When I booked the room, your staff didn ’ t mention this. And the brochure and your promotional mailings do not mention that.
column7: Are you quite sure?
column8: Yes. Have a look.
column9: I see. I had no idea our advertising was so misleading. It is here, but it ’ s in the fine print on the last page.
column10: Perhaps you could arrange to provide me with a new bill that reflects the advertised rate.
column11: Normally I couldn ’ t do that. But under the circumstances, I ’ ll see what I can arrange.Customer satisfaction is our primary aim.
column12: Thank you.

column1: This is great, isn't it?
column2: It's the most fun I've had in years.
column3: We should do this more often.
column4: Yes, we should.

column1: My eyes water continuously. Why?
column2: Perhaps because of the dirty air.
column3: What is there in the air?
column4: Some poisonous gas.
column5: I can't believe that the air in this city is so dirty.
column6: Yes. I think I won't come here again next time.
column7: So do I.
column8: We waste a vacation.
column9: Maybe you are right.

column1: Could you tell me how to use the library?
column2: Sure. All you need is your student ID card or admission card to check out books and read journals or magazines in the library.
column3: How many books am I allowed to check out at a time?
column4: Two books at a time. Except magazines or journals, they have to be read within library.
column5: How long can I keep the books?
column6: For one month. If you can ’ t return the books in time, you'll be fined. But if you renew them, you can keep them longer.
column7: I see. Now I want to check out two books on spoken English. Can you show me where I can find them?
column8: Yes, just over there to your right.
column9: Thank you very much.
column10: You ’ re welcome.

column1: Good morning, young lady. You can call me Ma. Do you see anything you like?
column2: Yes. Many things! I especially love this beautiful quilt.
column3: That quilt was passed down to me from my ma in Holland.
column4: It sounds like a special quilt. Why do you want to sell it?
column5: Well, this home is too big for me now, so I'm moving to an apartment that is much smaller. Therefore, I need to part with a few things.
column6: Oh, I see. Umm, how much do you want for the quilt?
column7: Is fifteen dollars OK?

column1: Yes, I think there is something wrong with my car.
column2: What's the matter?
column3: When I tried to back it, I found it was out of order. I can't see where the trouble is.
column4: Let me see.
column5: Is it serious?
column6: No, the damage is minor.
column7: And when will it be OK?
column9: OK. Thank you.

column1: What ’ s the Mountaineering Club doing this weekend?
column2: We are going to climb a cliff on the Colorado River.
column3: How hard is the climb?
column4: It is a very difficult climb because there are not many places to put your hands and feet.
column5: What did you do last week?
column6: We rappelled down the side of 300 - foot cliff. It was very exciting.
column7: Wow! That sounds like a lot of fun. I ’ m sorry I missed it.
column8: Well, you should come this weekend. I think you could do the climb.
column9: Yeah, I will. See you then!
column10: O. K. See you.

column1: Waitress.
column2: Yes sir. How can I help you?
column3: Please clean up the table.
column4: OK. And anything else I can do for you?
column5: I like a refill please.
column6: Sure.

column1: Can I help you?
column2: Yes, I ’ m doing some research on Roman civilization. Do you have any books on the subject?
column3: These books over here are about ancient history. They might be helpful.
column4: Can I check this one out?
column5: I ’ m sorry. It ’ s for reference only, so it must stay in the library. But you ’ re welcome to look through it.
column6: Ok. And I ’ d like to check these books out.
column7: All right. They ’ re due back next Wednesday.
column8: Thanks for your help.

column1: What do you think of your teacher?
column2: He's very strict with us.
column3: And I hear he gives very good lectures.
column4: Indeed. He's strict with himself too. We can see every lecture of his is well-prepared.

column1: I'm planning on going to the market soon.
column2: What are you buying?
column3: I don't know what we need.
column4: I can check for you, if you'd like.
column5: I'll make a list.
column6: First, we need eggs, milk, and bread.
column7: Okay, do we need any meat?
column8: How about some chicken, ground beef, and some steak?
column9: What else do we need?
column10: Get some snack foods.

column1: Jim, I heard you ’ Ve bought a new computer.
column2: Yes. Look, it is on my desk.
column3: Your office looks different with a computer. By the way, is it difficult to use a computer?
column4: Not at all. It ’ s a piece of cake.
column5: A piece of cake?
column6: Yes. It ’ s easy and convenient to use a computer. But it takes a long time to really master it.

column1: Would you find any other available flight to Tokyo?
column2: Sure. We try our best.
column3: Thank you.
column4: Mr.Chen, are you sure you're taking BA - 007 back to Tokyo?
column5: Yes, of course. I think our travel agent would have made the reservation for us.
column6: I'm afraid this flight is all booked up.
column7: Are you sure? We can't really take it? I reconfirmed with Miss Peterson the other day.
column8: I'm afraid so except we have many no-show passengers.

column1: So, what ’ s new in the kitchen? That refrigerator is new, isn ’ t it?
column2: Yes. I needed a large one. Before, I had a separate refrigerator and freezer, but this has both combined into one.
column3: That ’ s usual nowadays. You ’ Ve added a few shelves too.
column4: Yes. You know I ’ Ve been cooking more kind of food recently and I needed some extra space for spices and ingredients.
column5: Did you buy new cupboards too?
column6: No, I didn ’ t. I gave them a really good clean, so they just look new. The worktop was in poor condition, so I had a new one added.
column7: I see that you have bought several new pots and pans and utensils.
column8: Yes, I have. I need them to help me with these new dished I ’ m trying to make. I need a little more practice before I invite guests over.
column9: Looking at the spice rack, I ’ d say you ’ Ve been learning how to make asian food.
column10: Yes. I ’ Ve always likes Indian and thai food, so I ’ Ve been trying to make dishes from those countries. I ’ m pretty good at making curries now, but I still need practice at making thai food.
column11: Both kinds of food are becoming popular.Nowadays, it ’ s very easy to pick up the ingredients at the supermarket.
column12: I hope you can stay for dinner. I need a guinea pig!

column1: Is Tom in?
column2: Wrong number.
column3: Isn't this Li's residence?
column4: No, it is not.
column5: Oh, I'm sorry.

column1: Hi, I'm Benjamin. Nice to meet you here. You look great.
column2: Thank you. Nice to meet you too. I'm John. Is this your first time to take a long-distance trip on plane.
column3: No, this is the second time. But I also feel bad because of the lower pressure and the jet lag.
column4: Oh, I am sorry to hear that. Take it easy. It will be OK soon. You see, I take this long-hour plane frequently, but the jet lag still makes me uneasy.
column5: Oh, that's too bad. Do you get a good knowledge of China?
column6: Yes, whenever I think about China, I'd see the Tian'an Men Square. China is a very beautiful country. And I've seen many landmarks in China but I like the Great Wall most.
column7: All of the Chinese are proud of the Great Wall. And it was built before the In dynasty near Shan Haiguan-the First Pass in the World.
column8: Was it built before the In dynasty? I thought it was in the Ming dynasty.
column9: No, before the In dynasty.
column10: Oh, yeah. Thought I am an American, I know quite a lot about China and I like Chinese tea very well.
column11: Both the green tea and the black tea are good for our health. And I usually refresh myself with a cup of tea.

column1: Susan has got married.
column2: Really? How do you know that?
column3: Her marriage was a hole and corner affair.
column4: Why? That ’ s good news, but no one knows it?
column5: I have no idea. Maybe she didn ’ t want to let us..., so...

column1: Can I take your order now, Madam?
column2: Yes, what would you recommend?
column3: I'm happy to recommend the fish, It testes delicious, and it is today's special. Our chef is from the coast, and love seafood. Today special is actually his favorite dish. so I'm sure it is a
column4: It does sound wonderful, maybe I'll try it.
column5: Is there anything else? Maybe I can interest you in one of fine appetizers, such as the escargot.
column6: Not today, thanks. But I'd like to know any of the vegetarian dishes.
column7: Yes, here's the menu. What would you think of your order.
column8: Maybe I don't want the fish, I think I had the greenbean dish instead.
column9: What kind of soup would you like?
column10: I'd like the egg drop soup.
column11: Ok, is that all?
column12: Yes.
column13: what would you like anything to drink or you wait?
column14: Just nice water, thanks.

column1: My uncle passed away last night.
column2: My condolences.

column1: What brings you to Beijing?
column2: I'm here on business.

column1: Everything is OK now, doctor.
column2: That was quick work. Let me have a look at it. Yeah, everything looks fine now. Thank you very much.
column3: You are welcome, doctor.
column4: How much do I owe you?
column5: The total is 87 dollars. Here is the bill.
column6: Really? You worked here for just half an hour. I consider the price very high.

column1: This is a great meal!
column2: Thank you. I am glad that everything turned out so well.
column3: Who taught you how to cook this well?
column4: I took a cooking class at the Culinary Institute.
column5: Wow, what is in this chicken dish?
column6: Isn't that great? That is coconut ginger chicken with rice.
column7: Is the soup a shrimp soup?
column8: Yes, there is shrimp in there along with sea vegetables and lemon grass.
column9: I think I got lucky in choosing a wine that blends with this meal.
column10: I appreciate you bringing the wine. It goes well with the chicken.

column1: Wow, that terrible movie is finally over. Next time I ’ m picking the film, because I don ’ t want to end up seeing a chick flick.
column2: Well you should have picked, in the end you always complain about everything.
column3: Not everything, just this film. Even the title is ridiculous, and it ’ s so long, those are the two and a half most wasted hours of my life, so much so that I ’ m thinking about asking them to give me my money back.
column4: I ’ m thinking of taking you back home. I thought we could have a nice evening, but you ’ re always so negative.
column5: I ’ m only complaining about a movie that I could have rented or bought and then thrown in the garbage.
column6: You see, that ’ s what I ’ m talking about, I can ’ t stand your sarcastic jokes anymore.
column7: Next time, go with your gay friend who is more in touch with his feelings.
column8: Well he ’ s more of a man than you are ; at least he appreciates love stories.
column9: Love stories? More like one-night-stands.
column10: Don ’ t criticize Mario or else I ’ ll start on those fat, drunk friends of yours, they ’ re no saints.
column11: My friends? Fat? What about those whales you call friends?
column12: You ’ re unbearable, you can walk home, I ’ m leaving.

column1: Joe, how are you doing?
column2: I am great! How about you, Mary? How are you?
column3: I am doing great! Thank you for asking, Joe.
column4: I was wondering if you want to go see a movie with me tonight?
column5: I need to stay home tonight and finish my term paper.
column6: OK. What about going to the movies on Friday night?
column7: What were you planning on seeing?
column8: I was thinking about seeing that one about the rapist serial killer.
column9: How about “ The Secret Life of Bees ”?
column10: That's a chick flick!

column1: I would like to book a table for 2.
column2: OK, sir. When will you be there?
column3: 7:00 tonight and we'd like a smoking table.
column4: No problem, sir.

column1: Tonight is a party night! What drinks do you think we need?
column2: Well, not everyone wants to drink beer. Make sure there are some soft drinks and juice. Nothing's as refreshing as iced drinks on a hot day.
column3: I don't think we need too much in the way of soft drinks, Two super bottles of Cola should cover everyone. What about wine?
column4: Just buy a cask of wine. Have you bought ice yet?
column5: No, once I fill the tub with beer, I'll get the ice. The beer will be cool if you put the tub under the ice. The cooler, the better.
column6: I think a bottle of champagne would be a good idea. It's appetizing and tasty.
column7: Well, if you say so. Personally speaking, I'd rather die of thirst than drink champagne.

column1: Good morning, Sue.
column2: Good morning, Tom.How are you?
column3: I'm fine, thanks, how about yourself?
column4: Things couldn't be better.Where are you going now?
column5: I am heading for the library. I've got a research project to do.How about you?
column6: I'm going to the English class.It' ll start in five minutes, I've got to run.
column7: See you later, alligator.
column8: After a while, crocodile.

column1: I'd like to reconfirm my plane reservation.
column2: What flight are you taking?
column3: Flight 201.
column4: And what's your name?
column5: Anderson.
column6: Everything is in order. Please check in at the airport an hour before flight time.
column7: Thank you.

column1: How about a movie tonight?
column2: It doesn't matter to me.
column3: Does 7 o'clock suit you?
column4: Either way. I don't care.
column5: How about a snack after work?
column6: I couldn't careless.
column7: Would you rather stay home?
column8: Whatever you say.
column9: Are you really interested in doing something?
column10: I don't mind if you want to.

column1: I think I'll write a book.
column2: What about?
column3: All of the time tested healthy habits from around the world.
column4: You have done a lot of traveling. I'll bet you've learned quite a bit.
column5: The interesting thing is to see what really works and what's just hype.
column6: Because you can see the results with the general public?
column7: That's right. I think we all have much we can learn from each other.
column8: I would buy that kind of book!

column1: It's late.It' s high time I left.Thank you for a most wonderful evening.
column2: Don't mention it.
column3: Good night then!
column4: Good night!

column1: S :: Welcome to Flash Foto.What can I do for you, ma ’ am?
column2: C :: I ’ d like to have this roll of film developed.
column3: S :: What size prints would you like?
column4: C :: Four by six will do.
column5: S :: All right, ma ’ am, they ’ ll be ready for you in an hour.

column1: How did I do?
column2: Do you really want to know?
column3: Yes, I do.
column4: You did pretty bad.
column5: Exactly how bad?
column6: You didn't pass the test.
column7: I don't understand how I could've failed it.
column8: There are a few reasons why you failed.
column9: What are the reasons?
column10: The main reason is the fact that you're a horrible driver.
column11: Can I take the test again?
column12: You'll be able to take the test again in a couple weeks.

column1: We'd like a half-day package.
column2: We offer many different sea water treatments.
column3: How many can we choose?
column4: The aquamedic pool is included. You can choose three.
column5: We'll do the seaweed wrap, the jet bath, and the foot massage.
column6: OK. Here are your robes. You can go shower first.

column1: Er... Alison?
column2: Ohm, hello, Marcia. I was...
column3: I just wanted to congratulate you! I mean, it was a good race and you deserve to win.
column4: Well... thanks, Marcia.It' s very nice of you to say so. I mean...
column5: It was that final sprint! You were great! Really!
column6: Do you really think so? I mean, was I? Er... you... must be disappointed.

column1: I have some good news for you.
column2: What's that?
column3: Jenny is getting married.
column4: Great! Who's the bridegroom?
column5: Tom, that lucky guy.
column6: The guy always hands the girls in a line. When did he propose?
column7: Last week, It said that he fell in love with Jenny at Mrs.Whit' s party last Monday as soon as he saw her.
column8: My gosh! How romantic! When's the big day?
column9: July 4, the National Holiday.
column10: Will it be a church wedding or a civil ceremony?
column11: Jenny plans to hold it in church.
column12: Who is the best man?
column13: Guess!
column14: Nobody is OK, but you!
column15: You know, Tom is my best friend and he asked me to be his best man.
column16: Did you promise him?
column17: Yes, I did.

column1: We're in big trouble, Jason. Nick is beating us by a long shot.
column2: Impossible! Well, I'm not giving up yet. It's not over till the fat lady sings!
column3: OK, comeback kid. Here's you last question.How many times did Robin Williams win the Oscar for Best Actor?
column4: Hmm. Let's see... there was Good Morning, Vietnam, Dead Poet's Society, The Fisher King... Three, right?
column5: Nope, sorry! Actually, Robin Williams has never won an Oscar for Best Actor--only for Best Supporting Actor!

column1: Would you like to come out with me tonight?
column2: Sorry, I can ’ t.
column3: Tomorrow night, then?
column4: I ’ d like to. But I ’ m afraid I can ’ t.
column5: I ’ m wondering if you like to go to the theatre then.
column6: That ’ s sounds great.
column7: Ok. How about give me a ring, then?
column8: No. I ’ d better not.
column9: Why not?
column10: Because I don ’ t think my husband would like it. Thank you for inviting me anyway.

column1: Jodi, I must get a hold of Jim today, but I forgot his address and phone number.
column2: Don ’ t worry about it. I have his pager number right here.
column3: Really? You ’ Ve helped me a lot. Thank you.
column4: Forget it. It ’ s nothing.

column1: I need to find the cereal aisle.
column2: The cereal is over by the breakfast foods.
column3: Where is that at?
column4: It's by the oatmeal and breakfast bars.
column5: I think I can find that.
column6: Did you need help finding anything else?
column7: Actually, I do need to find the dishwashing detergent.
column8: That would be over by the paper towels and toilet paper.
column9: I thought it was over there.
column10: Yeah, you'll find it there.
column11: I really appreciate all your help.

column1: Hi, Mel, would you like to come and have a cup of coffee this afternoon?
column2: I ’ d love to, but you know I ’ Ve got another appointment. I ’ m really sorry.
column3: I see. Then what about tomorrow, at Starbucks?
column4: I ’ m afraid not, George. You gotta know something, I ’ m not available any more. but I know Becky has a crush on ya.
column5: Are you kidding me? Becky? She ’ s a real bitch.

column1: Can I order something from the kitchen?
column2: Just tell me what you'd like, please.
column3: A bottle of champagne, lobster tail, and filet mignon, medium rare would hit the spot.
column4: I hate to tell you this, but we have no more filet mignon. May I suggest the porterhouse instead?
column5: Sure! Right now, I would even eat hamburger!
column6: Have you ever tried chocolate-covered strawberries with champagne?
column7: Thank you, but I just finished eating some chocolate-covered cherries.
column8: That'll be a bottle of champagne, lobster tail, and porterhouse, all charged to your amenities account.
column9: Not a problem.
column10: Please call if you have any other requests. Your food will be delivered promptly.

column1: Mr. Bellow, have you anything in mind as to what to drink or may I make a few suggestions?
column2: I have had enough gin fizz and bloody mary. But I have no idea about Chinese cocktails.
column3: Would you prefer our cocktail — Shanghai cocktail? It's a mixture of real Chinese ingredients.
column4: That ’ s good.
column5: ( The waiter makes the cocktail for Mr. Bellow and hands into him. ) Here is your Shanghai cocktail, Mr. Bellow.
column6: Thank you. Oh, it tastes excellent.

column1: And what's your vision?
column3: Mine's 20/20. Life just isn't fair, is it?
column4: Oh, yes, it is.
column5: What do you mean?
column6: You'll find out when we're in the woods and you have to go to the bathroom...
column7: They don't have toilets at the campground?
column8: Let's just say I'll have it easy...

column1: I ’ Ve gotta hand it to you, you really did a good job!
column2: So glad that you think so!
column3: I think you deserve a promotion.
column4: Oh, really? Thanks a lot... well, I still have a lot to learn, I guess.

column1: You seem to be very hesitant about doing things.
column2: I don't know why I cannot take a step forward.
column3: You are meeting trouble halfway, I guess.
column4: Many things are troubling me. I don't know whether I should come and go.
column5: That's where the shoe pinches.

column1: You look upset, is there anything wrong?
column2: Yes, to tell you the truth, there is.
column3: What is it?
column4: Well, I've lost my wallet and my ID card.
column5: Oh, that's too bad! I am sorry to hear that!
column6: Forget it, there is no use crying over the spilled milk.

column1: Hi there! I am looking for a new car. I have this old Ford Pinto that I would like to trade in.
column2: I see. You are in luck this month because all of our models are on sale! it is a perfect time to buy a new car since it ’ s the end of the year.
column3: Perfect! I like this one.
column4: That is the Ford Focus. A very light but powerful vehicle. It comes with dual side airbags, power steering and power windows, tinted windows and your choice of either automatic or manual transmission.
column5: Sounds like a good car! How many miles to the gallon?
column6: It is a very fuel efficient vehicle giving you about 34 miles in the city and 40 on the highway.
column7: That is really convenient. Especially now that fuel prices are so high! What ’ s under the hood?
column8: A very powerful 2.5- liter turbocharged engine, Trust me, this car is fast!
column9: Now for the most difficult question. What is the price tag for this lovely vehicle?
column10: Very affordable sir. You can take it out of this lot today with 0 % down payment and no interest for the first year! You can test drive it now and we can sign the papers when we get back.
column11: Great! Let ’ s do it!

column1: Can you please give me a hand? I can ’ t carry the heavy box.
column2: I ’ m afraid not. Don ’ t you see I ’ m looking up a word in the dictionary?
column3: I think you are flicking through it.
column4: Well, wait a minute.

column1: Room service.May I come in?
column2: Yes.please.
column3: Here is your laundry. I am sorry to tell you that one of your clothes has shrunk due to our fault.
column4: Oh, my god.
column5: We are terribly sorry for that.Could you please buy a new one and give us the receipt? We will refund the cost of the laundry and the new sweater.
column6: I hope so.
column7: Would you please fill out the form?

column1: Could you change this note for me, please?
column2: Yes. How would you like it?
column3: Eight tens, six ones and large silver for others.
column4: OK, here you are.
column5: Thanks.
column6: It's OK.

column1: What do you do besides work and watching TV?
column2: When I have some time, I like to exercise.
column3: Do you go jogging or do you go to a health club?
column4: I joined Samsung Health Club a couple of months ago.
column5: How do you exercise?
column6: I usually spend 30 minutes on the bicycle for the Carpio, and then I lift weight for about 45 minutes.
column7: How often do you go?
column8: I want to go four times a week, but I'm too lazy. Last week, I only went to workout once.

column1: I just discovered that I owe $ 10 for a movie that I never ordered.
column2: Let me check, sir. You were charged for watching' Titanic' Monday night.
column3: That is absolutely incorrect! I was out on the town Monday night.
column4: Okay, sir, bear with me a moment.
column5: Thank you for taking my word over the computer's word.
column6: One slight problem, sir. I need to charge you $ 2 to remove this error from your file.
column7: You can
column8: I feel your pain, sir.
column9: Absolutely unbelievable! You people should be ashamed of yourselves.
column10: I agree with you, sir, but all I do is work here.

column1: Hello. I want to reconfirm our flight to London.
column2: Yes, sir. Did you call the airline?
column3: Yes, I did. But I couldn't communicate with them in English.They speak only Spanish.So I need your help.
column4: Certainly, sir. What is the flight number and when are you leaving?
column5: We are taking IB 385 to London tomorrow at 1 p. m.
column6: Oh, I see, sir. We have the airline office inside the hotel. They have an English-speaking staff. Just dial 35, please.

column1: Hey, May. How about getting together for a movie tonight?
column2: Sure. What's playing?
column3: Well, Let me check the newspaper. What about The Terminal?
column4: Wow, it stars Catherine Zeta-Jones, my favorite actress.
column5: Well, birds of a feather flock together. I like her too. She was in a lot of dramas.
column6: She is so beautiful and elegant. And she is famous for her fine acting.
column7: What's more, she doesn't have scandals. And she likes to take part in the charitable activities.
column8: Who is the director?
column9: Steven Spielberg. Another superstar.
column10: Yes, a legend, also. I still remember, his movies, Jurassic Park and Schindler's List got him nine Oscar awards in 1994.
column11: Can you introduce the story of The Terminal briefly?
column12: It tells a romantic and humorous love story.
column13: This is really exciting movie. Lets go to this one.

column1: You look a bit dull today. What's up?
column2: Well, my mum lost her job yesterday.
column3: I'm sorry to hear that. Well, I heard that registered urban unemployment rate reached 4 percent this year, with more than half being women.
column4: The supply outstrips the demand in the job market and women are in a disadvantageous position as a whole.
column5: Yeah, it's true. What is she going to do?
column6: Well, she is thinking of doing some household cleaning or baby sitting in the community.
column7: That's not bad. It could be a short-term alternative. Your mum can look for another one when the market improves. Things will work out eventually.
column8: Thank you. I just hope she won't feel pressed.

column1: I was meaning to ask you if you saw the basketball game on Friday.
column2: I wanted to go, but I couldn't.
column3: It was a great game.
column4: It's too bad that I couldn't make it. Who won?
column5: Our team played hard and won.
column6: I really wish I went to the game.
column7: It was the best game ever.
column8: So tell me the final score.
column9: The other team lost by three points, 101-98.
column10: It must've been a close game.
column11: It really was. You should've gone.
column12: Hopefully, I'll make it to the next one.

column1: Shall we have some soup first?
column2: No, thank you. I don't like soup. I'd rather have some fruit juice to start with.
column3: Ok, and what about the main course? Which would you rather have fish or meat?
column4: Meat, I think.
column5: Don't you like fish then?
column6: I do, but I want meat.
column7: Shall we have some white wine then?
column8: Yes, but I prefer red wine with meat.
column9: What would you like for dessert?
column10: I just want to have a coffee, I think.
column11: Fine, and after dinner, shall we go to a disco?
column12: No, thanks. I'd like to go straight home. I'm very tired.

column1: Can you help me, please? Is there a public restroom near here?
column2: I'm sorry, but I don't think so.
column3: Oh, no!! My son needs a bathroom.
column4: Well, there's a department store on Grant Street. There are restrooms in the basement.
column5: Where on Grant Street?
column6: Between Second and Third Streets. The store is across from the hotel.
column7: Thank you very much.
column8: You're welcome.

column1: OK. Come back into the classroom, class.
column2: Does the class start again, Mam?
column3: Yes, but to the heath, this break has last long enough.
column4: Oh, breaktime flies.
column5: come on, baby. It ’ s time now.
column6: Mam, another minute, could I?
column7: Hurry up, little boy.

column1: How do you put this seat back? I know there is a lever somewhere.
column2: What are you doing?
column3: I'm getting dressed, what does it look like?
column4: It looks like you are about to get dressed. Did you forget we are in a car on the road?
column5: I'm good at this. Nobody will see anything.
column6: Are you kidding? You're going to cause an accident just from people gawking!
column7: All right, pull over at that service station and I'll dress in the ladies' room.
column8: That will be my pleasure.

column1: Honey, do you have a second?
column2: Sure! Are you okay? You seem a bit worried.What ’ s on your mind?
column3: We need to talk.
column4: Okay...
column5: I ’ Ve been thinking, and well, I think we need to start seeing other people.
column6: What? Why? I mean, we ’ Ve had our ups and downs, and we have the occasional disagreement, but we ’ re happy together, aren ’ t we?
column7: That ’ s just it, I ’ m not happy anymore, Tim. It ’ s not you, it ’ s me. I know that I can be hard to deal with, and you are a great guy! You are the type of guy that any woman would kill for!
column8: So, what are you saying? You ’ re breaking up with me because I ’ m perfect?
column9: Tim, you are too good for me. You deserve someone who can make you smile and make you happy the way that you made me happy. Oh, I could say that I ’ ll be all you need, but that would be a lie. I know I ’ d only hurt you, I know I ’ d only make you cry.
column10: Baby, come on. Don ’ t do this to me! Whatever it is, we can work it out. Just give me another chance! I know that we can get through this, but we gotta stick together! Don ’ t leave me.
column11: I can ’ t, Tim. I hope someday you can find some way to understand I ’ m only doing this for you. I don ’ t really wanna go but, deep in my heart I know this is the kindest thing to do.
column12: Laura...
column13: Here are your keys. I ’ ll send my sister to pick up the rest of my things next week. I ’ m sorry, Tim. I wish you all the best, and I hope that one day we can meet again. I ’ ll always love you. Goodbye.

column1: Mm... How do I get this ticket machine to work?
column2: Well first put your money in.
column3: Ok, I ’ Ve done that.
column4: Then just press this button.
column5: Oh it ’ s printed the ticket already. Thank you very much.
column6: You ’ re welcome.

column1: Good evening, madam. May I help you?
column2: I want a facial. But this is the first time I've come here, so can you tell me how you do it?
column3: Sure. Most facials start with a thorough cleaning. Then we usually use a toner to invigorate the skin, followed by exfoliation treatment-a peeling mask or scrub that removes the dead cells that make the skin lock dull. After that, we'll massage your face and neck with oil or cream to improve the circulation and relieve the tension, followed by a mask to moisturize and soften the skin.
column4: That's exactly what I want. How long does it take?
column5: We have half-hour and one-hour treatments.
column6: What's the regular price?
column7: Well, the half-hour facial costs 50 yuan and the one-hour costs 80 yuan. If you want make-up, another 20 yuan will do.
column8: Good, I will take the one hour facial with make-up.
column9: That's fine, madam.
column10: By the way, could you give me a manicure? Use a light nail-polish, please.
column11: Yes, madam.

column1: Have a nice weekend!
column2: Thanks.You too!
column3: Do you have any plans?
column4: Well, my family's away and I can't afford to do much.What about you?
column5: Oh, I haven't decided what I'm going to do yet.

column2: Well, my whole family is in the United States now, but we're from Costa Rica originally.
column3: Oh, so you're from South America.
column4: Actually, Costa Rica isn't in South America. It's in Central America.
column5: Oh, right. My geography isn't very good!

column1: what are you doing ;

column10: Do you still like playing those games?

column1: Good evening! This is Mr. Smith in room 609.

column5: I have to be at the conference room of the Garden Hotel in Shanghai by 10 o'clock. I think it will take me three hours to get there. It means that I'll have to be on the road before 7 o'clock at the latest.
column6: That's right.
column7: Well, in that case, I would like you to wake me up at 5:45.
column8: OK. Good night, Mr. Smith, Have a good sleep.
column9: Good night.

column1: Hey Jack. How's it going?

column4: That girl in my econ class. She is so hot.

column7: Does she have a boyfriend?
column8: I don't think so. I've been following her around campus and I haven't seen another guy.
column9: Dude, you're a stalker man. Just ask her on a date.
column10: I plan on running into her in the cafeteria when she's alone. I think I'll ask her then.
column11: So why do you think you're in love?
column12: She's the only thing I can think of all day long.
column13: That's called blind love. Well, I gotta run. Tell me how it goes next week.
column14: Aright. I'll talk to you later.

column4: From April 16th to 20th. Just my wife and myself.
column5: R :: From April 16th to 20th.And which kind of room would you prefer, sir?
column6: A Twin, please.
column7: Could you hold the line please? I ’ ll check our room availability. ( After a while ) Thank you for waiting, sir. We have a twin room at US $ 180 per night, will that be all right?
column8: Ok, I ’ ll take it.
column9: Thank you, sir. May I have your name and phone number, please?
column10: Sure. May name is Aaron Johnson, and my phone number is 3242-5827.
column11: R :: Mr. Aaron Johnson, phone number is 3242-5827. Excuse me, how do you spell your first name?
column12: It ’ s double A, R, O, N.
column13: Double A, R, O, N. Thank you, Mr. Johnson. May I know your arrival time on April 16th?
column14: Around 9 p. m.
column15: Mr. Johnson, for the unguaranteed reservation, we can only hold the room by 6 p. m., because it is the peak season now. If you make a guaranteed reservation, we can hold the room overnight. Would you like to make a guaranteed reservation by credit card?
column16: Fine. Do you accept American Express?
column17: Yes. May I know the number?
column19: Thank you, Mr. Johnson. You ’ Ve made a guaranteed reservation at the Guangzhou xx Hotel, from April 16th to 20th for 5 nights. If you can ’ t arrive as schedule, please inform us before 6 p. m. on April. hank you for calling and we look forward to serving you

column1: Excuse me. Miss, what does the doctor say about me? When can I be discharged?

column4: First please get the bill at the doctor's office, then pay it either with cash or by check. Even though you're discharged, you still need to take a rest at home. Don't hurry back to work until you have fully recovered.
column5: Yes, I will. Thanks for your care.

column10: Now that I have an idea of what you want, I can begin my search.

column4: Well, sometimes I think of how things could have turned out if I had done things a little differently.
column5: For example?
column6: Like for example, if I hadn ’ t studied architecture, I would have become an artist like I wanted to.
column7: I see. Yeah now that I think of it, I wouldn ’ t have gotten married if I hadn ’ t moved to this town and met Sally.
column8: You see! Everything happens for a reason! We wouldn ’ t even have met if I hadn ’ t been in that car accident ten years ago!
column9: Well, I have no regrets!
column10: I ’ ll drink to that!

column2: Two cars forward.
column3: What time will breakfast be served?

column6: Please drop it at the front desk when you leave the hotel.

column4: Yeah, I ’ m dealing with it. Anyway. Thank you, Mike.

column2: First, you should check the schedule and see which trains go to Suzhou. Make sure which train you want to take and book a ticket.

column4: It depends on which train do you take.
column5: Is it far from here to Suzhou?
column6: Yes, it stops more than ten times on the way to Suzhou.
column7: How long will it take to get there?
column8: About fifteen hours.

column1: Would you like to have some icecream? I've got a variety of flavors for you to choose from. I've got strawberry, peach, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and praline.
column2: Wow! So many choices you have! I wish I could, but I just can't. I'm on a diet to lose weight.
column3: Come on, just a bite. It doesn't really hurt to have just a bite.
column4: I'd better not. Please don't tempt me. Please!
column5: Gee! You are really strong-willed.
column6: You're damn right. I'm not so easily coaxed into doing something that I think is wrong.
column7: Well, I'd better not tempt you. Otherwise, if I give you a piece of cake, you might ask for a glass of milk.

column1: Jane! What an enchanting skirt you have on!
column2: Thank you! Guess how much it costs.
column3: Bright colors, smooth material, exquisite craftsmanship, soft lines... Darling, it looks elegant on you! It can't be any cheap stuff. Something around two hundred, I guess.
column4: Your offer is way off the mark. It set me back only sixty-five.
column5: Then you got a windfall! Was sixty-five the original price, or did you get a special discount?
column6: Neither. I drove a hard bargain with the vendor before I got the price down.
column7: How much did she ask for?
column8: Three hundred! That's daylight robbery. How dare she play tricks on an old hand like me? Without hesitation, I gave my offer---no more than fifty.
column9: She must be fuming with anger at such a bid, wasn't she?
column10: Not at all! She's really been around, and seemed quite accustomed to bargaining like this. That's the trade. She only demanded a higher bid, saying the purchase price was even higher than seventy. She was lying! Then I inquired,' May I have it at sixty?' she waved her head.
column11: Then you pretended to go without buying it?
column12: Yeah. I turned around and started to move out. Just then, she yelped behind my back,' all right, all right! I may sacrifice a little. Let's fix it sixty-five! Can't be cheaper.'

column1: Don ’ t be worried. Please sit down and take it easy.
column2: How could I feel easy? I ’ m really pissed.
column3: But you should avoid finger-pointing when you haven ’ t got the real facts.
column4: Ok. I ’ ll try my best to calm down first.

column1: I heard a rumor this morning... It seems Trusten Tools is going out of business.Another competitor is going bankrupt.That could be good news for us.
column2: I think you must have heard wrong.The truth is we are going to be taken over by Trusten.We are being bought out, and our company will be merging with our largest competitor.It' s not good news at all...
column3: What? We are merging with Trusten? I never thought that would happen.Will we be getting new owners? Will it affect our jobs?
column4: Probably.The new owners will be coming to start alignment meetings nextweek.One of the big question is what to call the new conglomerate company.
column5: Wow, with such a big change.We won't have the same name?
column6: It's not only the name of our company that will change... I expect that after this acquisition, there'll be a ton of things up in the air.

column6: I'd be glad to. Do you need anything else?

column8: That would be my pleasure. I'll wrap the perfume up in the gift box for you too.

column1: Good morning, Passport, please.
column2: Here you are.
column3: Ah, thank you. Please bring your luggage here for inspection.

column7: Well, the cigarettes and the champagne are not in excess of the duty-free allowance. But according to our law, each passenger is allowed only one camera duty-free. You' ll have to pay duty for the other one.
column8: Ok. Where shall I pay duty for it?
column9: Please wait a minute. I'll make out the duty memo... Here you are. Take this and pay to the woman over there.
column10: I've paid for it. Here's the receipt.
column11: Very well. I hope you' ll enjoy your stay in America.
column12: Thank you.

column6: Ok with me. You are the boss. I will meet you downstairs after work.

column4: it takes about 3 minutes per person, so it ’ ll probably be about an hour ’ s wait.

column4: Basketball and swimming.

column3: The house is a little too old.
column4: But it's quite convenient for you to go to any part of the city. The subway is nearby.

column2: It was exciting!

column5: Oh, I don't know.It depends.

column2: No, I was way too busy studying all the time. How about you?

column4: What was that like?
column5: It was always very busy there.
column6: What did you do?
column7: I stood behind the register and took pizza orders.
column8: Did you get any perks on the job?
column9: Yeah, I got to eat as much pizza as I could for free.

column1: You are late.
column2: I'm sorry, it was too cold, and my car couldn't start. I had one to the garage with the heater. I tried to call you, but you couldn't get connection.
column3: Couldn't get connection?
column4: Yes, your number is out of service.
column5: Really? I didn't know. Let me check. You're right.
column6: So I couldn't get through.
column7: It's a serious problem. I make expecting an important call. The theater is guilty. It supposed to call me this evening, and discuss my play. What were happened if they can't reach me?
column8: Well, the only thing you can do is pay the fee to recover your service.

column1: Hello. Good morning, Stately Restaurant. May I help you?

column4: For four people. We'd like a quiet table with a fine view of the river.

column10: Bye-bye.

column1: So what kind of music turns you on?

column3: You mean the kind of stuff like Nirvana?
column4: Not really. That ’ s pretty heavy metal.

column4: If you ask me, I have to disagree. Something shouldn't be watched for fun.

column4: We could go to more places this time, if you liked.

column7: Why not sometime next week?
column8: No, let's go on Saturday.
column9: OK.
