column12: No, I don't like that place. Why don't we try the garage Martin recommended?
column13: Fine, We'll do that.

column1: Look, Jimmy's report came today.
column2: Let's have a look. What is this? Where are all the grades?
column3: He's in the third grade Sam! You see under each subject that he is being taught in school, he receives a mark from one to three. A one means his achievement or work is excellent. Here in Science for example he got a two, which means its satisfactory.
column4: What about here in physical education?
column5: He got a three here which means it's unsatisfactory. We should work on that with him.
column6: So confusing! In my day we got an A or B if we were doing well and if we failed an exam we would get an F!

column1: Oh, what a beautiful garden!
column2: These are my roses. The roses have been in flower for a week.
column3: The garden looks lovely when the roses are in bloom. You must have a lot of pleasure in planting flowers.
column4: Yes, you are right. I love flowers and hence have taken to growing them. I take care of my flowers every day as if they are my good friends.
column5: You did a good job. But I got tired of working in the garden.
column6: Oh, I see. People who don't understand the nature of flowers won't be able to grow them well. I can help you learn more if you want to plant flowers one day. In this way you need not be afraid of your own sweet flower-garden's being neglected.
column7: Yes. Thanks.

column1: Waiter, the meat is overdone.
column2: I am sorry you don't like it, sir. But that's just the special point of the dish.
column3: Is it?
column4: Yes, hope you can enjoy it.

column1: Toronto is really a lovely place to visit.
column2: What attracts you most?
column3: The Old Town, the Distillery Historic District, the Financial District and Underground City, everything is so attractive.

column1: May I help you?
column2: Yes, do you have sweaters?
column3: This way, please. How do you like this one? It's made of cotton.
column4: You have quite a range, haven't you? I would like to see some other styles.

column1: Have you got anything for diarrhea?
column2: Yes, here you are. These tablets are very effective.
column3: How should I take this medicine?
column4: Take two tablets every six hours.
column5: I see. I'll follow your instructions.
column6: And take a good rest for a few days.
column7: Thank you.

column1: Excuse me. Can I change my seat with you? I want to sit beside my friend.
column2: Where is your seat?
column3: It's 9 - A in the middle part, a window seat too.
column4: OK, you mean the vacant one on the left?
column5: Yes, it is. Thank you very much. Let me help you to carry your baggage there.
column6: No need. I have only this small handbag with me.
column7: Thanks. Have a nice trip.

column1: Well, you seem to enjoy speaking English.
column2: You can't help learning when you're using it all day. You'll see. A few weeks'study in the school will have a similar effect on you.
column3: I hope so. You see, at the moment I find it difficult to get used to the teacher's speed and accent. I'm awfully worried, I can't reply as quickly as she seems to expect.
column4: Oh, she likes keeping us on our toes by getting us use English throughout the class. She doesn't mind your making mistakes, though.
column5: You know, speaking in class is a very good chance to put your English to practical use.

column1: what date is it today?
column2: why?
column3: look at the girls in the street. They all have bunch of flowers.Is it Valentine's Day?
column4: Oh, yes! I completely forgot about it.
column5: did you have a fight with Jack?
column6: no, but now he'll be in trouble. What's a boyfriend for? To forget about Valentine's Day?
column7: come on, dear! You forgot it, too.
column8: you know, it's OK for a girl to forget these " big days ", but for a guy, to do that is unforgivable.
column9: is that your phone?
column10: oh, it's Jack. Excuse me.
column11: wow! good timing.
column12: he asked me out to a dinner tonight. How about joining us?
column13: come on! three's a crowd!
column14: so what?
column15: just go! it's Valentine's Day!

column1: John, my father isn't there at all. Are you kidding?
column2: Cool, fellow, what's the date today, buddy?
column3: It's... oh it's the 1st April, April Fool's Day.
column4: You forgot all of about it, didn't you?

column1: Do you take reservations?
column2: Of course. Reservations aren't necessary, but we recommend them as our restaurant can get quite busy.
column3: I need a table for two for tonight.
column4: What time?
column5: We'd like to be seated at 8p m.
column6: Smoking or non?
column7: Non-smoking.
column8: What name is the reservation under?
column9: My name is Paul.
column10: Ok. Please arrive at seven forty-five. We can only hold the table until 8,15.

column1: I've been accepted by the university, and they've offered me a position on the basketball team!
column2: That's wonderful! Icing on the cake.

column1: What kind of films do you like best?
column2: I like feature films best. How about you?
column3: I don't like feature films. I think sometimes it loses contact with reality. I like to see some documentary films. What kind of feature films do you like best?
column4: I always like to see the oldies, like The Sound of Music, Gone with the Wind. They are realty the best - in the acting, the scene and the plot.
column5: You are sort of romantic.

column1: How did you meet your boyfriend, Cindy?
column2: We were in the same science class last term.
column3: Who made the first move?
column4: I did.
column5: Wow!
column6: It was no big deal.
column7: What do your parents think of your dating a boy?
column8: They're glad that I finally got a boyfriend.
column9: They're glad?!

column1: What a beautiful watch. It goes very well with your ring.
column2: Thank you.
column3: Is that your wedding ring?
column4: I'm not married yet. It's my engagement ring.
column5: Well, congratulations. When is the big date?
column6: In June.
column7: Did you have the watch before getting the ring?
column8: Actually, we bought the ring together after I got the watch.
column9: You did a fabulous job with the selection. It's gorgeous.
column10: Thank you so much.
column11: What kind of watch is it?
column12: It's a Tag Heer.
column13: If you don't mind me asking, how much do they cost?
column14: This one is $ 1500. But they range from $ 600 to $ 3000.
column15: That's why it looks so nice. I should have figured. You always get what you pay for.
column16: Yeah. I would rather get one nice watch instead of 20 mediocre ones.

column1: Did you lock the doors?
column2: All except the back door. I left that open for Tim. He took the dog for a walk.
column3: Well, I ’ m going on to bed. I ’ m beat.
column4: Ok, I ’ m going to stay up awhile. I ’ Ve got to go over the household budget, We ‘ re a little over-spend this month.
column5: Please told Tim to close the door to the basement. I don ’ t want dog down there tonight.
column6: Ok, Good night, see you at breakfast.

column1: Welcome to Al's Bakery. What can I get you?
column2: Hi! Let me get a dozen croissants, four blueberry muffins and a loaf of sourdough bread.
column3: Sure. Would you like to have the loaf sliced?
column4: No, that's OK. Do you have any whole wheat bread?
column5: We are out at the moment. May I suggest some rye bread?
column6: Sure that sounds good. Do you have any cakes?
column7: We have various birthday cakes and also ice cream cakes.
column8: I'll just take a cheesecake.
column9: Will that be all?
column10: Yes.
column11: Your total is forty three dollars and twenty cents.

column1: Bob! Your eyes look bloodshot. Did you not sleep well?
column2: I had a drop too much last night. I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine. And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table.
column3: you have it right. Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China. Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship, especially in Northern China.
column4: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me. But if I keep gulping down one cup after another, I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick.
column5: you lose face by refusing to drink, and the host might think you refuse to give him face. The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up. This will endear you
column6: a few guys even threw a drunken fit last night, crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood.
column7: then he must be opening his heart to the friends. In a word, as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort, no one will jeer at you.
column8: I got you. Next time. I'll preface a toast with a statement like' I can't drink any more' and then drink anyway.

column1: Have you brought the receipt with you?
column2: No, I don't. I left it home.
column3: Sorry, but we can't do anything without the receipt. Come back with it.
column4: I didn't know. I'll go to get it. How late will you be open?
column5: Till 5:30.

column1: Did you meet the new girl in our sales department. She is taking the place of Maggie during her alternative leave.
column2: Did they finally fill that post, how come I haven't seen her? She must have not been inducted yet.
column3: I guess not, They haven't officially introduced her to the whole staff yet, she barely started yesterday.
column4: Is she just working temporarily? What are they going to do when Maggie comes back from leave.
column5: If the new girl is competent, maybe they will promote her when that time comes.

column1: good afternoon! Can I help you?
column2: could you show me where the Chinese-style clothing is located? I want to buy a silk coat.
column3: this way, please. Here they are. They're all handmade.
column4: oh, they look nice. May I try that back one on?
column5: of course. The fitting room is right over there.
column6: do you have a medium in the same color? This one is a little tight.
column7: I'm sorry. All the back of that size are sold out. Would you like a red one?
column8: ok, let me try it on. what do you think?
column9: oh, that suits you very well. Besides it is believed in China that the red color brings happiness and good luck.
column10: really? I'll take it, and I'm leaving here tomorrow. Is it possible for you to send one in black to me by mail when you gte it in?
column11: our pleasure. Please fill out this form, leaving your address and telephone number.
column12: thanks. Who much would that come to?
column13: let me see...

column1: My daughter plans to quit her present job and wants to find another. She says she wants to get a better job with higher pay.
column2: It seems quite normal to me. It is pretty much what I want to do.
column3: But what about settling down to start a family? Doesn't anyone want to get married any more?
column4: It is different now. The world is becoming colorful. Some of my friends don't feel the same pressure to marry. We all want to wait for the right moment.
column5: What time is the right moment?
column6: Let the universe find us instead of forcing love. We prefer natural love. The most important thing is to be happy. Love will find us later. That is what we say.

column1: Pardon me. Could you help me?
column2: Of course. How can I help you?
column3: I am looking for a sweater.
column4: What size do you wear?
column5: Medium, I think.
column6: Here. How do you like this one?
column7: It's pretty. Can I try it on?
column8: You can try it on in the fitting room over there.

column1: I ’ m itching for moving!
column2: What ’ s the matter? What annoy you?
column3: It ’ s so wet and dark, I ’ m just fed up.

column1: How about you and Tom? What time is your wedding?
column2: Don ’ t be kidding, OK?
column3: What ’ s the matter? So angry. I ’ m just playing a joke with you.
column4: Because I have given him up as a bad job. Our relation has been over.

column1: Do you believe in UFOs ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: But I never saw them.
column4: Are you stupid? They are called UFOs, so not everybody can see them.
column5: You mean that you can them.
column6: That's right. I can see them in my dreams.
column7: They come to the earth?
column8: No. Their task is to send the aliens here from the outer space.
column9: Aliens from the outer space? Do you talk to them? What do they look like?
column10: OK, OK, one by one, please! They look like robots, but they can speak. Their mission is to make friends with human beings.

column1: Good afternoon, sir.What Can I do for you?
column2: Well. I can't find my key now. I think I have lost it.
column3: Really? Have you left it in your room?
column4: I don't think so. I took it with me when I went out this morning.
column5: Well, in that case, you have to pay for it. Please fill out the form first.

column1: I'm afraid I have lost my air ticket while I was shopping.
column2: I'm sorry to hear that.Did you check your shoulder bag carefully?
column3: Yes, I checked again and again, but I can't find it. By the day after tomorrow, can I have the ticket reissued?
column4: I'm afraid you can't.
column5: I talked with the manager over the phone and he told me I can have it reissued because I have a copy of my lost ticket.
column6: Oh, I see. I'll call the manager, then.

column1: Hi, Mr. Smith. I ’ m Dr. Hawkins. Why are you here today?
column2: I thought it would be a good idea to get a check-up.
column3: Yes, well you haven ’ t had one for... five years. You should have one every year.
column4: I know. I figure as long as there ’ s nothing wrong, why go see the doctor?
column5: Well, the best way to avoid serious illnesses is to find out about them early. So, try to come at least once a year for your own good.
column6: O. K.
column7: Let me see here. Your eyes and ears look fine. Take a deep breath, please. Do you smoke, Mr. Smith?
column8: Yes.
column9: Smoking is the leading cause of lung cancer and heart disease, you know. You really should quit.
column10: I ’ Ve tried a hundred times, but I just can ’ t seem to kick the habit.
column11: Well, we have classes and some medications that might help. I ’ ll give you more information before you leave.
column12: O. K., thanks, doctor.

column1: Do you have laundry service?
column2: Yes.We have an excellent service here.
column3: Well, would you please send someone to 502? I have some clothes to wash.
column4: OK.

column1: Look at this headline - Elvis Baby Born on Spacecraft. Where do these tabloids get such crazy stories?
column2: I ’ Ve often wondered the same thing. I also wonder who reads them. Then I realize that I ’ m standing here reading them myself.
column3: It looks as though everyone in line reads them, or at least looks at the headlines.
column4: I think we picked the right line. This one seems to be moving more quickly than the others.
column5: Maybe our checker is faster at scanning the food.
column6: I ’ m glad. We have only about twenty things here, and I ’ m in a hurry to get home.

column1: Hi, come on in. Can I take your coat?
column2: Sure, thanks. I brought you a bottle of wine as well.
column3: You're the first guest to arrive. I'll just put your coat away and then I'll get you something to drink.
column4: Should I take my shoes off?
column5: Whatever you prefer.
column6: This is a very nice place. How long have you been living here now?
column7: Just over three weeks. Would you like a drink?
column8: Sure, what do you have?
column9: I've got white wine, red wine, gin and tonics, ginger ale, lemonade, orange juice, and sprite.
column10: I'll have a glass of red wine please.
column11: One glass of red wine coming up!
column12: So how many people are coming for the dinner tonight?
column13: There's just going to be 6 of us tonight.
column14: Oh, I thought there were going to be eight. who isn't coming?
column15: Marcia and Paul called to cancel at the last moment. Paul was running late and Marcia wasn't feeling well.
column16: That's too bad.They' re such good company.
column17: I think there's someone at the door. Excuse me while I go and get that.

column1: Hi Isabel! You wanted to see me?
column2: Yes Anthony, come on in. Have a seat.
column3: Is everything okay? You seem a bit preoccupied.
column4: Well, Anthony, this is not going to be an easy conversation.The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment.
column5: Okay...
column6: I don ’ t want to beat around the bush so I ’ m just gonna come out with it. We are going to have to let you go.
column7: What? Why? I mean... just like that? I ’ m fired?
column8: I ’ m sorry but, to be honest, you are a terrible employee!
column9: What! I resent that!
column10: Anthony, you were caught making international calls from the office phone, you called in sick in eight times this month and you smell like alcohol!

column1: Too bad you missed Jane's performance.
column2: How's it?
column3: It was so perfect that it won a unanimous 10.

column1: Excuse me.sir. Can I have look at the timetable please?
column2: Surely of course.Here you are.
column3: Is flight ZW203 a direct one?
column4: No, it stopped at Honolulu.Would you like to book one?
column5: No. Is there any direct flight to New York?
column6: Let me see. I am sorry. ZW203 is the only one to New York.

column1: He has a long head, I bet he will do well in his business.
column2: He does, he started five years ago and now ends up the richest among us.
column3: When we were students, he was no good in any subject.
column4: It seemed to be useless to study well when we were young if we examine his case.

column1: So where is this mystery restaurant that we are going to?
column2: It' s an Indian restaurant! I know you have never had Indian food, so I thought you might want to try.
column3: That sounds great! I am craving some type of beef dish.
column4: Well, Indian cuisine actually doesn' t serve beef. You see, cows are a sacred animal, a very important element in the Hindu religion, so beef is not eaten.
column5: I see, so what are we having? Chicken?
column6: There are many amazing dishes to choose from. We can have some chicken tikka masala which is an amazing curry. It' s a bit spicy, but I think you can handle it.
column7: Sounds good! I have always heard that Indian spices give a rich flavor to food.
column8: Yeah. Also, we can have some Naan bread which is baked in a tandoori oven. Since you don' t use any utensils to eat, you can use this bread to scoop up the curry or rice.
column9: What about veggies?
column10: They have a good variety of vegetable-based dishes like talak panter, vegetable samosas or daal.
column11: It all sounds exquisite! I can' t wait!

column1: Mr. Smith, I would like to get right to the point here. First, we need to talk about how much each company will pay.
column2: Well, we want to have the largest share. Our company is much larger than yours, and we have been in business longer.
column3: Let's look at that another way. The major point is the value that we add, not who has been in business longer, or is bigger.
column4: What are you thinking about?
column5: We do not want to place ourselves in an inferior position. We are a good, small company---that's why you are interested.
column6: Then, what would make you feel more comfortable?
column7: If you take a 75 % position in the venture, we would take a back seat to you.

column1: How nice these frames are!
column2: Yes, they are the latest designs. Would you like to try them on?
column3: I want to try on this pair.
column4: The oval shape one?
column5: That's right.
column6: I think it suits you well.
column7: I agree, but I like wire frames.
column8: How about this? They're the same shape.

column1: Thank you for bringing me here Hong, this place looks great!
column2: You ’ re welcome. Would you like some cold dishes?
column3: Let me see. How about the lotus root?
column4: Ok, and anything to drink? Maybe some jasmine tea?
column5: Oh, yes that would be nice.
column6: And for your main course? I can recommend the sizzling beef.
column7: Actually, I ’ m vegetarian so I ’ d like to have the bean curd.
column8: Oh, that ’ s a good choice. Very healthy too.

column1: So how long do you plan to live here?
column2: We'd like to sign a year-long contract, if that's OK.
column3: Fine by me. Do you know how to read this kind of contract?
column4: Yes. We've signed them before. We even brought our chops.
column5: Great. When in Rome, you guys know what to do.
column6: We'll sign our signatures, too. And give you our passport numbers along with our ARC numbers.
column7: That about does it. See you in a week.

column1: Can I help you, sir?
column2: I want to find a book called Gone with the Wind. But I can't find it.
column3: Let me give you a hand. The author is...
column4: Margaret Mitchell.
column5: Oh, yes. Here it is.
column6: Thank you very much. I have been looking for it for a long time. Is this the latest edition?
column7: Yes, we have both the paperback and hardcover. which would you want to buy?
column8: How about the price of the hardcover?
column10: A little bit expensive, but I will buy one. This is $ 25, here you are.

column1: Excuse me, what time do you expect to land in Berlin?
column2: We should be there by 5 this afternoon.
column3: Do you have any idea how long it will take to clean customs?
column4: Well, it all depends on traffic from other arriving aircraft.

column1: Sir, may I please see your license and registration? Do you know how fast you were going?
column2: No, I'm not sure. I think about 65 mph, right?
column3: You're not sure? You were going at 90 miles per hour! That's 25 mph over the legal speed limit! Have you been drinking?
column4: No, Officer, not at all.
column5: Then how can you explain your behavior?
column6: Well, I guess I just wasn't paying attention to the speedometer.
column7: Not paying attention to the speedometer? Why not?
column8: Um, because I was busy talking to my friend.
column9: On a cell phone?
column10: Yes, I was using a cell phone. I just bought it, so I decided to give my friend a phone call to tell him about it. While I did that I also turned on the radio and was listening to one of my favorite songs, and eating some food I had bought at a fast food restaurant, and, um... guess I had too many distractions.
column11: That's definitely true. I'm going to have to give you a ticket. Please remember to drive more carefully next time.

column1: OK, Devon, I've been putting on a few pounds and you're quite a lean fit guy.
column2: Well, thank you.
column3: What do you recommend? What can I do to lose weight?
column4: Well, I exercise a lot. I go running at least three times a week. But more than that I enjoy playing sports and so different sports use different muscles and all of it helps to lose that weight that you might have gained.
column5: Yeah, well, actually, one of the problems is that I actually exercise a lot.
column6: Do ya?
column7: Yeah, so maybe it's my diet.
column8: It could be and so in that case you might want to eat something perhaps more nutritious or maybe even less of what you do eat. Maybe, I eat three meals a day and I try not to snack in between. No potato chips. No popcorn. No candy bars.
column9: That's pretty tough!

column1: Mike, these flowers are just gorgeous.
column2: I ’ m glad you like them. Happy birthday!
column3: I can ’ t thank you enough. I ’ m really touched. I don ’ t know what to say.
column4: Forget it. It ’ s my pleasure. You mean a lot to me.
column5: You ’ re the best!

column1: it's a lovely day out today, isn't it?
column2: it's beautiful. Enjoy it while it lasts. It's supposed to get cold tomorrow.
column3: what's the weather forecast for tomorrow?
column4: it's supposed to snow early tomorrow morning and then tomorrow afternoon there's a chance of freezing rain.
column5: that doesn't sound pretty.
column6: do you have any plans for tomorrow?
column7: well, I was going to drive to Birmingham to see some friends.
column8: you might want to change your plans. With the cold and wet weather that we're supposed to have tomorrow, the roads are going to be rather slippery.
column9: I suppose I should. I don't like driving in dangerous weather conditions. Do you have any plans for tomorrow?
column10: I just have to go to class tomorrow afternoon.
column11: if you're lucky, it'll get cancelled and you can have a snow day!
column12: if that happens, then I'll invite you over and we can drink hot cocoa and watch movies.
column13: that sounds like fun.
column14: hey, look outside! It's started to drizzle!
column15: English weather is even more predictable than I had previously thought.

column1: I went shopping without my umbrella yesterday morning.
column2: Yesterday morning was beautiful I thought the sunning was going to continue.
column3: So did I. that's why I didn't take my umbrella. I got cold in the rain in the afternoon. It was raining cats and dogs.
column4: I know. I could not believe it when I got hit by that storm. It was pouring with rain all afternoon.
column5: We really have some movable weather sometime. I wish I would live somewhere which were sunning all year round.
column6: If it was sunning all year round there would be drought. You probably would not like it either.
column7: I guess you are right. Maybe I just wish the weather could be a little more predictable.
column8: The weather forecasters are not good at predicting the weather would be like. Our weather is so changeable.

column1: Now darling, I know that we've bought this house together, but it's just going to be far too expensive to decorate it. I think we should sell it.
column2: Oh, no, Nathan, I... I really think we've bought this flat at the right time, you know. Market prices are going to go up, and I think you'll find in a year or two it will be worth a lot more.
column3: But we're going to spend so much money in furnishing and decorating. I think we could get a much cheaper place that's already furnished.
column4: But don't you like this place? I remember when we came to see it we thought it would be lovely.
column5: Well, only you liked it really, darling.
column6: Oh, why didn't you say so then? But I still think we've made a good buy.

column1: Another glass of beer, will you?
column2: Thanks, I'm enough.
column3: At least one for your trip.
column4: I'll have it if you insist.

column1: I'd like to make sure my plane reservation is in order.
column2: May I have your flight number, please?
column3: World Airlines, Flight 201.
column4: And your name, please?
column5: John Anderson.
column6: Yes, sir. You're booked on Flight 201, leaving in one hour.
column7: Thank you.

column1: Here ’ s your hot dog and beer. What happened? Did I miss anything?
column2: Yeah, Cal Ripen just hit a home run.
column3: What ’ s the score?
column4: Well it was 3 to 4, but Ripen ’ s home run made it 5 to 4 since another player was on first base.
column5: So Baltimore is winning?
column6: Right.
column7: This is a really great place to watch a baseball game.
column8: Yeah, there isn ’ t a bad seat in the place.
column9: The fans are great here, too. Not like in Philadelphia.
column10: It was a great idea to spend a day watching a game.
column11: Yeah, it reminds you why they say baseball is America ’ s favorite pastime.

column1: What kind of place shall we rent?
column2: It should be close to the university. Neither of us are good at getting up in the mornings and closer it is, the later we can get up.
column3: Absolutely. That's the most important thing to take into consideration. I'm not too worried about the size of the flat.
column4: Neither am I. so a small place is ok, but we'll get a bigger one if it's not expensive. Do you mind if it's in a noisy area.
column5: I don't mind. I'm not a light sleeper, but quieter is better for when we have to study at home.
column6: Good point. Ok, let's go to the estate agent and see what they can offer us.
column7: Yes, if we're lucky we'll find something in the next few days. I think you had a good idea to start flat hunting early.
column8: How much do you think the rent will be?
column9: I asked a few people who are already living in places near the university and they said it would cost about one hundred pounds a month.

column1: See you later, alligator.
column2: In a while, crocodile.

column1: Two burgers, please.
column2: For here or to go?

column1: Some people are always closing their handsets, so it's difficult to inform them.
column2: Why not send them short messages?
column3: Can short messages reach them?
column4: Short messages will be kept in the short messages center. Once they open the handsets they will receive them, which is better than you can't find them.
column5: Why haven't I thought of this skill?
column6: I use short messages quite a lot. If it's not too complicated I will send a short message, which can save much phone charge.
column7: I am informed that many people used short messages to pay a New Year call, and only on the Spring Festival it amounted to 1 billion this year, didn't it?
column8: I almost can't live without messages, from which I learn about weather forecasts and stock quotations.

column1: do you like playing games?
column2: I like playing computer games, but I'm not really into board games.
column3: how about individual games like the Rubik's cube or solitaire?
column4: the Rubik's cube is so difficult to solve that I think it should be banned!
column5: if I taught you how to do it, I'm sure you could solve it.
column6: how did you figure out how to slove the Rubik's cube?
column7: I didn't really have to figure it out. I just followed the instructions!
column8: I had no idea there were a set of instructions. I thought everyone who could solve it were all geniuses!
column9: hints are really important when you're solving puzzles. If you give me some hints about playing that PS2 game, I ’ ll show you how to solve the Rubik's cube.
column10: it's a deal.
column11: do you remember, years ago, when everybody at the New Year's party had yo-yos?
column12: yeah. That was a strange party. Can you still do any of those yo-yo tricks?
column13: I don't know. I haven't tried yo-yo since that party!
column14: I could never figure out how to use my yo-yo.
column15: if you don't start when you're young, it's hard to get the hang of it.
column16: let's get started with this game then.
column17: ok.

column1: How do I take the tablets?
column2: Please take 2 tablets each time, 4 times a day.
column3: How do I take the sucking lozenges?
column4: Please put one under your tongue, do not swallow it.
column5: How do I take the pills?
column6: Please dissolve one pill in water before taking it.
column7: Well, thanks very much.
column8: You're welcome.

column1: It is high time you have a talk with him. That may help clear the mists.
column2: I did, but he gives me a runaround.
column3: If I were you, I would put the whole matter on the table.
column4: But he was trying to beat about the bush. And my talk with him was fruitless.

column1: This Olympic park is so big!
column2: Yes. Now we are in the Olympic stadium, the center of this park.
column3: Splendid! When is it gonna be finished?
column4: The whole stadium is to be finished this June.
column5: How many seats are there in the stand?
column6: Oh, there are 5000 seats in total.
column7: I didn ’ t know it would be so big!
column8: It is! Look there, those are the tracks. And the jumping pit is over there.
column9: Ah... I see. Hey, look the sign here, No climbing.
column10: We put many signs with English translations for foreign visitors.

column1: Excuse me, could you tell me where I can get a shopping basket?
column2: Yes, Madam. It is at the entrance.
column3: Well, I can't find the way to the entrance. Would you tell me where the entrance is?
column4: Okay. Follow me please.
column5: Thank you very much. By the way, where are the vegetables?
column6: In aisle 3.

column1: Oh, well. It was fun to be the winner. But... it's too big. I must be an extra small in the States.
column2: So what about the tennis racket?
column3: Look! It's amazing. I can't wait to try it out!
column4: How much did that end up costing you?
column5: Oh... around twenty bucks. A bargain if you ask me. Look at the picture of her playing with it!
column6: Hey, two for one. That's a super deal.
column7: And here's her signature!

column1: We really were lucky. We got the last available table for two---and we didn't even have a reservation! Did you see the long lines behind us?
column2: Yeah, I'm glad that we didn't have to wait long. I'm starving!
column3: Let's take a look at the menu so we can order. Do you want to choose an appetizer for us to share?
column4: What would you rather have, samosas or poppadoms?
column5: I heard that one of their specialities is the samosa.
column6: Well, let's get a plate of those then.
column7: Sounds good. What are you going to have for your main course?
column8: I think I might have a dahl.
column9: What's in a dahl?
column10: It's got chickpeas and vegetables in a spicy curry sauce with rice.
column11: That sounds nice. Do you want to share some kebabs as well?
column12: Ok. How about some lamb kebabs?
column13: That's my favourite. Do you want to have some wine or beer?
column14: I think I'll have a beer.
column15: Ok, shall I flag down the waitress?
column16: I wouldn't recommend it. I think we should wait until she comes round.
column17: You're right. That might seem a bit rude. It's a good thing I've got you with me!
column18: What would you do without me?

column1: Hey! What happened?! My song was only half way through and it skipped to the next song.
column2: I don't know what happened!
column3: You cancelled the song, didn't you, Jack?
column4: No, I didn't. Really!
column5: Then, is the machine broken or...

column1: Let's go practice your driving.
column2: If that's what you want to do, then we can.
column3: Did you buckle your seatbelt?
column4: I'm buckled up. What's next?
column5: You need to start the car now.
column6: What do you want me to do?
column7: Go left.
column8: How far should I go?
column9: I'll let you know when I want you to stop.
column10: Tell me before you want me to stop.
column11: All right, try parking here.
column12: Thanks. Let's go driving again tomorrow.

column1: I just love your hair that way.
column2: Thanks.
column3: Where did you have it done?
column4: My sister did it. When did you get yours cut?
column5: Just yesterday. I'm still getting used to it.
column6: Well, it looks very nice.
column7: Thanks.

column1: I heard that you went to the concert the day before? How did you like it?
column2: It was terrific.The concert was really a hit.The symphony orchestra was so good that I was completely absorbed in their performance.
column3: Who was the conductor?
column4: Oh, speaking of the conductor, he is indeed a genius.He did a perfect job.His name is Menuhin, a descendent of Russian American immigrants.
column5: Oh, I learned that he is also a legendary violinist.
column6: Absolutely right.He gave a performance of Felix Mendelssohn's violin concerto.That caused a sensation.The audience were stunned by his pure tone.
column7: Obviously you did enjoy the concert.
column8: Yes, I did.

column1: Which route are you interested in?
column2: I think the four days' tour from New York to Atlantic City will be fine.
column3: That's a good choice.
column4: What is the departure date?
column5: We have parties every Saturday from June to October.

column1: Where is that?
column2: Take me to the airport, please.
column3: Are you in a hurry?
column4: I have to be there before 17 o'clock.
column5: We'll make it except a jam. You know it's rush hour.
column6: There's an extra ten in it for you if you can get me there on time.
column7: I'll do my best.
column8: Here's twenty dollars.
column9: Do you have small bills?
column10: No. If you can't break it, keep the change. But can you give me a receipt?
column11: Here is your receipt. Thank you.

column1: What reason do you have for missing school?
column2: I was sick.
column3: How were you sick?
column4: I had a stomachache.
column5: Did it get any better?
column6: I'm still feeling under the weather.
column7: Would you like anything for your stomach?
column8: I took something earlier.
column9: Get better.
column10: Thanks a lot.

column1: I hear that you are in love with Mike.
column2: You are kidding.
column3: Don't you hit it off?
column4: Although we have many things in common, we'are not soul mates.

column1: Hello, who is speaking?
column2: Hello, this is John. I want to speak to Linda.
column3: This is her.
column4: Hi, Linda, I'm just calling to invite you to a dinner party tomorrow evening.
column5: Really? What time and where?
column6: 7:30 PM at London-Chinese restaurant. I \' ll be at your place at seven to pick you up if you need a ride.
column7: Yes, please, I'll need a ride. I'll be waiting for you then.
column8: See you tomorrow at seven. Make sure your dress a little formally. I heard the restaurant is kind of upscale.
column9: Thank you, see you then.
column10: See you.

column1: Hi Cody, how did practicing go this week?
column2: Well I had several tests and an oral presentation this week so I didn ’ t get a chance to memorize the second page, but I think I mastered the tricky section.
column3: Great! Warm up with some scales and arpeggios first. Good, good. This week, work on keeping the rhythm steady when you play the last part with the sixteenth note. Now let ’ s take a look at this tricky section.
column4: Charles? Before I start I was wondering if it was ok if I put a small crescendo in here and then decrescendo back to pianissimo again over here?
column5: It might work. I ’ ll have to hear it. Show me what you ’ Ve done. Not bad.
column6: It was horrible! I played play it much better at home!
column7: It ’ s just nerves. Just play the right hand for now. One two three four five six, ta ti tri-ple-ti. Good, good. Don ’ t forget the accidentals! The key signature says that note should be a G-sharp but now it ’ s a G-natural. Now add the bass clef. You ’ re going too fast. Remember the tempo for this piece is andante.
column8: Is that better?
column9: Yes, much better. Watch where you lift your foot off the pedal. What was that?
column10: Sorry! The stretch for that octave is always hard to make.
column11: That ’ s ok, keep going, you ’ re moving ahead by leaps and bounds. Watch your dynamics! Keep your elbows lifted. Remember to stroke the keys, don ’ t pound. That ’ s better! Remember that as a pianist or any other musician, your technique will be what separates you from the pack just as much or more so as your musicianship.

column1: Excuse me, is this the parcel post counter?
column2: No, it's at counter 1, right over there.
column3: ( At counter 1. ) Do you take parcels here?
column4: Yes.
column5: I want to send this package to Los Angeles, please.
column6: Do you want to send it by air or by regular mail?
column7: I'd like to send it by regular mail.
column8: I ’ ll have to weigh it first. 120 yuan, please.
column9: Here is 200.
column10: Your change, please.
column11: Thank you.

column1: I want to go house shopping, and I want to know what I can afford to buy.
column2: There is a formula that can help us figure that out. What is your annual salary?
column3: I earn sixty-five thousand dollars per year.
column4: What is the length of time that you have worked at the job you have now?
column5: I have been at the job I now have for 2 years, and I have been with the company for 6 years total.
column6: Do you receive any other income?
column7: I own a small rental unit with a partner, and I receive five hundred dollars a month from that unit.
column8: Do you know what your credit score is?
column9: I don ’ t know, but the last time I checked, it was very good!
column10: You are in good shape. Figuring in your other expenses, you can easily afford a house costing seven hundred thousand or maybe even a little more!

column1: Could I have the check, please?
column2: Okay. I'll just be a minute.
